Reviews.Title: “Best location in gran via”
Reviews.Author: NasserDXB
Reviews.Content: 4 rooms (2 standard and 2 superior) for 7 adults 23/27 aug 12. Absolute local 4 stars hotel in heart of gran via. You wont find better location. Gran via, sol, plaza mayor, royal place are all within short walking distance. Within a 100 meter radius, will find taxi spot, Mcdonalds, starbucks, cinema, grocery shop and local 24 hours pizza joint. Nice informative staff with good knowledge about places and their working hours. I agree that lighting in rooms was not that good but it was not big issue for me. I recommed the hotel and will stay here again Lighting of rooms was done by spot lights

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: Jose M
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on a possibly a bargain price $60 more or less. The hotel is pretty new in all its aspects Location: unbeatable, right on the heart of the Gran via, The hotel is the famous "schwepes" building. Public transportation is a step away. Very safe area. Room: not big, but its europe, very comfortable bed, nice clean bathroom Staff: very nice people If you are staying in spain and looking to explore Madrid, this is the hotel. Super centric, new and clean for a very reasonable price. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “City hotel in grim location”
Reviews.Author: linda316
Reviews.Content: We don't feel that this hotel should boast a four star status. Located between the main High Street and a rather seedy back street, it has a very small lobby/reception area (no seating whilst we were there). The bar/restaurant located on the first floor is modern with no atmosphere and therefore uninviting. At 15 Euros each the cooked breakfast was very poor, the cold buffet sufficient although many other nationalities seemed to have plates piled high so this may be a British view. The staff did their job but had no extra chat or civility to offer. The bedroom/bathroom was dark with poor lighting, but a good size and very clean with comfortable bedding and air conditioning that just about dealt with 41 degrees heat. It was quiet only because we were on the 7th floor - had we been lower down the traffic and drunken behaviour would have been fairly continuous throughout the night. Unfortunately Madrid has many many beggars and vagrants some camping in boxes outside the front door of the hotel, which we found very uncomfortable. Compared to another 4 star hotel in the same road which had a security guard on duty and no vagrants outside the Vincci seemed to have none in place. We generally did not enjoy Madrid although there is some very attractive architecture and pleasant surrounding areas outside of the Gran Via, Puerto Sol and Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but its a bit strange”
Reviews.Author: allaboutcricket
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two different hotels in Madrid, the first one being the Emperador Hotel just 2 mins walk from the Vincci Capitol. However I was most looking forward to the Vincci Capitol having stayed in its sister hotel in Salamanca and that was great. We paid the extra to have a room with a terrace which was nice but the solid brick wall is so high when you are sitting down you can't see over it. Our room was very dark and a very narrow and long. You had to literally squeeze past the end of the bed to get to the wardrobe. The bathroom again was dark and was the strangest shape and design. The sink for example is massive with the taps at one end squashed against the back corner so when you turned it on the water didnt go all over the sink. The plughole was close to the tap and you had to manually lift out the stopper to let the water flow down, not nice really when the water has been used or else leave the stopper out and have a massive hole you could drop your toothbrush down. The bathroom needed a major overhaul and this disappointed me as it was more money than the previously mentioned Emperador. Check out my other review for this hotel. The bar was atmosphere-less. We went in it a couple of times and were the only people. Not even any bar staff. You have to ring the bell and hope someone comes to serve you. You would think the view would be stunning as the bar is on the 8th floor (I think, its high up anyway) but the windows with the view down Gran Via was filled with a massive dining table to seat about 20 people which you wouldnt sit at if you were only two, like we were. the reception is on the ground floor but there is no foyer and only one sofa to seat two people. Personally I think this hotel is trying to be something it isn't, perhaps they have visited the crazy Bear in London/Beaconsfield/Oxford but really havent pulled it off. Having said all that our stay was pleasant, the reception staff were very helpful and the bed was comfy but I wouldnt stay there again. There are better hotels in Madrid for this price despite its excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here. This hotel has a great location in the heart of Madrid on Gran Via. The famous Spanish department store is just a few meters walk from the hotel. Retiro Park and the Royal Palace are in walking distance as well as some really good restaurants. It is easy to acess the undergound line.They charge extra for breakfast so we decided to do it out of the hotel. The only negative comment that I can make is the size of the room, it was extremely small, but acceptable if you are on a city tour all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: 49ENT
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were pleasantly surprised at how lovely this hotel was. The room was a spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and the roof top had a lovely view of the main street. The hotel is located in the heart of the city, so you can't go wrong. I would recommend this hotel to those that haven't visited Madrid before.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: macardy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the start of our trip and were pleasantly surprised. The real criticism would have been the size of the room, and the staff at reception were not overly friendly. The room was clean however and the location of the hotel could not have been better. So central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: We are a married couple with a 15 year old daughter and have just got back from Madrid, after a 3 day break on 4-6th July 2012. This hotel is in a great location with a couple of metro stations nearby and a food store next to the hotel. It's located right in the middle of everything and well worth a visit. The room we had was a triple and was a good size - the beds and pillows were very comfortable, and the air conditioning (although a little bit noisy) was very efficient, which was a good thing as it was over 30 oC during our stay. The roof terrace, on the 7th floor, was lovely, both during the day and evening. There is a phone for you to order drinks (all around 3 euros - for soft drinks and coffee) but you can take your own!! It cost us 30 euros for a taxi to the hotel, which took about 15-20 mins! The only slightly negative comment I could make about the hotel, is that the room's decor is looking a bit old, and we would've liked to have tea and coffee making facilities, but the room and bathroom were very clean, and I would recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay, flexible staff, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BasV1976
Reviews.Content: the room was great, awesome view on Gran Via (main road in city center) and nice roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, happily recommend”
Reviews.Author: Chonner
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel, it was pretty nice and very reasonable in price (hotels.com). The room was clean and the location was great, literally right in front of a metro station. Easy access to the airport in under an hour and less than 3 Euros I think. The terrace really enhanced my experience as I made good use of it by just relaxing out there on a great summer night after a long day of work. Unfortunately there is no free WiFi in the room and only on the 7th floor. My local co-workers brought me to a great restaurant about 10 mins away walking. You may need reservations but the name of the plae is La Cocina de San Anton by Cinco Jotas.(tele 913 30 02 94), definitely the highlight of my trip in terms of food.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: sheena g
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, located on the Gran Via and very central. It's comfortable and the bedroom and bathroom are a good size. Walking distance to all the shopping, and the main squares whilst also close to 3 underground stations with one being right outside! Nevertheless, there was no iron in the room, we requested one from reception and were told the hotel did not have one! We used the laundry service to iron (press only) 2 items of clothing and we were charged 20 Euros - beware! The reception staff are very rude, no welcome on arrival and no goodbye on check-out, other than that - all great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Offaly R
Reviews.Content: This was a nice modern stylish hotel slap bang in the middle of Madrid. The breakfasts were nice and the bar was good but only stocked bottled beer and closes at 10pm during the week anyway. The front desk staff were a bit lukewarm but could speak good English. The bar and restaurant staff were nice. I would recommend it for the location and the relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaLeurini
Reviews.Content: We have been in this hotel in the middle of March 2012.It was simply perfect! Good position.. all is reachable by foot but, if you are tired, the underground is in front of the hotel. The room was clean, amazing, the bedroom big and comfortable. Breakfast wasn't included into room's cost, we payed 12€ and it was huge and sooo good. Really reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Needs some improvement for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kristin M
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is near perfect and the rooms are spacious and modern. However, there are some issues to note. First, the front desk staff has a very poor attitude. Considering they are in the hospitality business, they should be more welcoming to tourists. Second, they have NO WIFI in the hotel, which many tourists rely on to keep in touch while on vacation. I would even be willing to pay for it, just make the investment so its available. Finally, we booked a non smoking room but had the smell of smoke coming through the air vents during our stay, which was a major turnoff. I am not sure if they accidentally put us in a smoking room or just have a poor ventilation system.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamiel0ve
Reviews.Content: it is my favourite hotel in Madrid, Often I'm there and this is the best I found.big and spacious room, clean bathroom and good breakfast with several choices.great location, in the center, easy to reach every nice side in Madrid, we went to Retiro Park, Museo del Prado, plaza de Espana and other place very easily. metro station really near

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs some renovations and an attitude adjustment.”
Reviews.Author: oshen4293
Reviews.Content: I came here with my mother and my aunt. When we arrived, no one came out to help up carry in our luggage, which was somewhat shocking. Also, most of the staff did not speak English or even try to help us since we didn't speak Spanish. The rooms were nicely decorated, but the shower was horrendous. The glass sidings on the shower and the tiles were loose, so what leaked everywhere. We had to use the bathtub because we didn't want to flood the bathroom. When we were checking out, I had to receive and load to luggage on the trolley myself. The elevators were so tiny that I got stuck and could not exit the elevator. Even when I called for help in Spanish, no one came over to help me get the trolley out of the elevator, so I could exit, too. I do have to say that the Vincci Capitol is in a great location in Madrid. It is right outside the Callao metro station and a quarter of a mile from Sol. We were literally in the center of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Debbie1507
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and has interesting Art Deco design features. The rooms are spacious. The showers do leak a bit due to glass door design, but they supply plenty of towels! Staff is helpful. Breakfast buffet was delightful, varied fruits, cheeses, and breads.

Reviews.Title: “Mariana Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mariana L
Reviews.Content: Near to metro station. Nice and friendly staff. Confort able and clean room. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: david w
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying in this hotel for four days last week. Comfortable rooms, nice breakfast. Shower screen doors a bit ineffective as water leaked onto floor. Very central location. Staff friendly and helpful. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ice cream”
Reviews.Author: Eleanna G
Reviews.Content: I know this is a bit late but just read your response to my complaint and regarding the icecream I need to inform you that we had bought the ice cream out of the hotel and asked for 2 spoons to eat it in the room and the room service asked for 2 euro to bring them up.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: The First thing is the location, Awesome could not get any better. The lighting is hilarious press a button and hope, the rooms are great, the soundproofing as we were on the 3nd floor was excellant,as proved by opening the window the noise was huge coming from the Gran Via. The hotel has done the best it could with a old building its a bit like sticking a square shape into a circle, the Bar is on the 1st floor but also serves the patio on the 7th so you can be waiting to be served quite a while, otherwise dont book this hotel if you are expecting 5 star, dont get me wrong its a great hotel with great staff, the older barman whom served us was great and so the reception staff, but its Weird in a nice way, just dont look up when your in the bathroom needs serious TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danniix
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, Rooms were kept very clean. A few maintenance issues eg: Shower door not being much use as water leaked through a bit whilst having a shower, And our wardrobe door didnt shut properly but these things were minor and didnt bother us. Even though the hotel is located on the gran via (which is very busy at night) we didnt hear a thing outside! The spa is absolutely amazing, would definitely recommend! Staff were very friendly & spoke good english. Would most definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, convenient location, great views, no Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Elle T
Reviews.Content: I booked a package vacation to Madrid and Barcelona several months before my travel date, and I scored a fantastic deal. For the price I paid, I was very happy with this hotel. The hotel is modern, but not over-the-top (as in neon lighting, etc). It has convenient light settings in which you can set "mood" lighting with the push of a button. There are two terraces that have amazing views over Madrid. The location was incredibly convenient and my boyfriend and I walked almost everywhere! My one disappointment was that the hotel advertised free internet. Turns out that's only wired internet, so if you bring an iPad on your travels like I do - this will be useless. Apparently there's Wifi in the lobby but it didn't work when we were there. Also would be nice if there was a pool... but that's not a huge deal. I still highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “All design and no substance.”
Reviews.Author: littlepie
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location in the heart of busy Madrid. Everything is so close, metro, shops, restaurants, bars etc. However, the rooms are shoddy and falling apart. The interior, Art Deco inspired, and possibly all the plumbing was sourced from the 30's. The shower door doesn't shut and floods the bathroom floor. You can see the rot caused by previous water damage. Poor quality rooms. Great restaurant bar on the top floor with excellent view. Shame about the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Unusual hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: hardytours
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip in early February 2012. First of all the hotel is in a great location on Grand Via close to the centre of down town Madrid. If you are sightseeing this would be a great location in walking distance to most things. The hotel itself is very unusal and very different to the usual business hotel. The decor is in line with the theatres close by in this part of the city. The room was clean and tidy with many modern touches including a interesting lighting arrangement which was good unless you wanted to quickly put on a light in the middle of the night. The bathroom again was clean and modern. The biggest challenge being the shower which flooded the bathroom and regularly turned itself off mid shower. Breakfast was served in what appeared to be the bar but was good and varied. Overall I enjoyed the stay and it was interesting to stay somewhere different from the usual standard business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Let there be Light”
Reviews.Author: Carrocat
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel on two occasions, the second being for just one night on our way home. The first stay was in a room that certainly had a great view straight down Gran Via, and that was done out in a modern style. But, so small, with almost nowhere to put things- (thank goodness for window sills), and with a lighting system that could only be described as frustrating. Not only was the lighting poor, ( fortunately we had torches) but the system seemed to have a mind of its own, with bedside and bathroom lights apparently wired up to totally confound us. We requested a different room when we returned after a few days in Portugal, and this time, things were better. One of the staff did confide that they were not happy with the lighting system and they were hoping to improve things. Let's hope they have. However, hotel is very conveniently located to all the main action of Madrid, including the squares teeming with people and very clever street statues. The Metro is very convenient, including getting to and from the airport - and there are stations located close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, relatively inexpensive, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Blobblobblob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great location right in the centre of Madrid. If you book through the internet the hotel is quite inexpensive (for a four-star hotel in Madrid that is). I stayed here in May with my wife in a Superior room with a Queensize bed. The room was big, as was the bed. The bed was on the harder side, but that was fine for us. The rooms could use some maintenance (e.g. some cracked tiles, a non functioning light, wobbly shower-head etc). The service depended a bit on the person you were talking to. But all in all the hotel was very good value for the money. The breakfast was very generous with a lot of variation. I would definitely recommend this place and stay here again. One tip: Be very clear if you want a non-smoking room. We booked one, but when we entered the room, you could clearly smell smoke. Luckily changing rooms was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: karris_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from 5 days in the beautiful city of Madrid. While we would definately return to Madrid we would not return to this hotel what a disappointment this turned out to be. My husband booked this on the internet and accidently booked 2 rooms by mistake, when we discoverd this we telephoned to say there had been a mistake and they had took the payment twice, they would not refund us and were quite adamant about that so we eventually got them to upgrade us to a superior room with breakfast, when we got there we did indeed get a superior room and they let us know that they were doing us a favour, we had ended up paying over £800 for this room . The room itself had fantastic views up the gran via but that was they only thing it had, we couldnt read at night as the room was too dark , we had a wet room shower type thing that leaked water, very little space for clothes etc, a tiny toilet, and a mini bar that required you to take out a second morgage to afford to drink from it. The breakfast would have cost 15 euros each if we hadnt got this added on , you wouldnt pay 5 euros for the breakfast, the breakfast staff were very nice as was the housekeeping staff, the reception staff were a bit uppity. This hotel tries to be very modern but it really looks like a room in an ikea store. We asked for some ice one night at 11.15pm and the receptionist nearly had a fit telling me loudly that the bar closed at 11. The only people this hotel would appeal to are between the ages of 18 and 25 it is quite possibly the worst hotel we have stayed in. On a brighter note Madrid was fantastic and well worth a visit. if you do decide to book this hotel it is in a great position but then Madrid has so many good places it doesnt matter where you stay. Pick a cheaper hotel and spend your money in madrid, we got a peek at the normal rooms and i dread to think what they would have been like as you couldnt swing a cat in them.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable location, almost below average service”
Reviews.Author: Lucie81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed in excellent possition, in the photogenic and photographed Schweppes buillding, facing the main part of Gran Via, on plaza Callao. Gran Via is Broadway madrileńo, with all its lights, theatres and hustle and bustle, and callao is a little Times Square so to say. Maybe from nowhere else you may have such an unforgettable view on Gran Via. Futher, the hotel has solarium with sun beds, sofas and showers on the seventh, and terrace on the ninth floor. So far so excellent. BUT it also has its (quite numerous) flaws. The hotel is so to say overdesigned and the designer did a lousy job. I do not thin he ever thought twice about his project and if I were Vincci executive, I would go never accept such a project. Why? Because: ((i) everything, but EVERYTHING is black lacque. THe doors, the furniture, the corridors, the, the the... can you imagine the poor cleaning ladies ever being able to wipe all the lacque down properly? Off course not. Result? isible dust and previous guests fingerprints everwhere. DISGUSTING. (ii) when not black lacque, why not colourless plastic? again, not practical for quick cleaning, fingreprints everywhere... (iii) the sophisticated light systems and its regimes. You have welcome regime, relax regime, tv watch regime, bath on regime....result? No matter what you do, yo do not get proper light in your room. You cannot have light in the bathroom without having a bit of light on in the sleeping room, etc....in combination with black you feel like in a dark cave, not a room. (iv) the rooms simply do not work. E.g. when using the oh so designed shower, the water doesnt go away from its bottom thansk to oh so stylish stones on its ground and when you then open the door, there is a flood in the whole room. WHen using the tub on the other hand, it is so nice and so big, but it has such sharp (stylish:))) angles inside, that it is not comfortable to sit in there. And the water outlet does enormous noise, (v) The choice of colours and decorations in the entire building including the breakfast area does not give a fel of a four star classy and modern hotel. It feels like a noght club or a brother which has its best days far behind, because all those oh so trendy black laques and other materials that were used were not of the best quality and the construction works were not done the best way so everything is peeling, tearing, going off... It certainly is not a four star hotel in treating its guests. The front desk staff really could plaster at least a BIT of smile on their faces. No smile, no welcome, no info on uipgrade of one of our rooms, no info on where and when the breakfast is, on pay tv and internet (with extraorbitant prices so no tiv and internet) and not on spa which I was longing to use but after the way they treated us, seeing the poor hygiene in the room (seeing that and STILL entering the waters of jacuzzi? I would have to be an idiot) and unable to read the conditions and price lists anywhere, I decided to spend the money outside of the place in the end. Furthermore, the staff were completely ignoring one of the persons staying in the room. In three day, we got only one shower gel, one shampoo, two pieces of soap and one toothbrush. And only one towel at time was replaced. Although BOTH were dirty. Huh? Further we got a room smelling like an astray although having specifically claimed and written anemail to the hotel 3 and half week prior to our arrival that we want a non smoking room. We had to leave the windows open for several hours and subsequently the room was so cold that we were trembling all night long and subsequently went sick (I am actually writing the review in bed). Next day, an additional card appeared in our room, keeping the airconditioning running to make the room warmer (and the air dryer). Note that there is no real heating system in the hotel. WHen we asked for additional blankets they only arrived after we went to the reception to ask again for the second time. Mind this, they were not clean. They had been used. Had some dirt sticking in the hair of the blankets. Huh? The breakfast was the brigher part of the stay. The buffet offered quite a lot of various possibilities, taking into account that SPanish are not a breakfast nation. It certainly was not like is Bavaria, Germany, but it was rich and plentiful. But be aware. I took a piece of honeydew which must have been lying around for four days or so, because it was sour. Other day, I noticed a highly stylish lady which spitting sour grapefruit juice back to the pitcher....(Besides, Spanish very little wash their hands after the loo, and dont get yourself fooled with LV bags, CH outfits and freshly coiffed hair....so be careful and rather touch the instruments using a paper tissue not to get some diarheea. it is the pure experience of life in Spain speaking out of me, not some hate - I love Spain.) DO not stay here if you hate Spanish style of bedding - sheets (with little holes) and not that clean blanket are on the scene here - when not friends with that, go Eurostars instead - my experience. I love the location of the hotel, because of the marvellous vista of bustling Gran Via with so different colours every hour of the day. Therefore I would ADORE to stay there again. But I will keep on looking for better place for my repetitive stays in Madrid becuase I want to GET four star treatment (smile? assistance) and service (especially cleanliness of the rooms) not only PAY that.

Reviews.Title: “What a position!!!”
Reviews.Author: capersCornwall
Reviews.Content: As it was our first trip to Madrid we really didnt know what to expect !!!! rooms were very clean and comfortable and the position was outstanding!!! The premiers in the area were amazing !!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kuwaiteiah
Reviews.Content: Every thing was perfect.. I will book in this hotel again and again when I'll visit Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Yolmac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on our recent trip to Madrid. Whilst the hotel is very central right in the middle of Gran Via and within walking distance to many of the sights of Madrid and many restaurants and cafes it is as mentioned in other reviews quite dark inside with lots of black, red and dark purple colours for walls and furnishings and service leaves a lot to be desired. Our room had cream walls but very dark floor boards and looking a little tired. Although we had booked a room with a double bed we got a room with two singles put together. The bathroom was really dark with weird lighting options which you could set to arrival, intimate or relax but when you set the bathroom light it also affected the room lighting and vice versa. Even then the lighting was not very bright. The airconditioner didnt work properly and we had a room which had the afternoon sun coming through the window, which made the room hot even with the sunblock curtains drawn. When we complained the service technician told us that we were expecting the airconditioner to be as cold as we have in it Australia which they do not have in Spain. Bit a of joke really. Lucky for us we were moving to another hotel the next day. Some of the staff were friendly but mostly they did not seem too interested in providing any service. We only found out by accident the day before we checked out that whilst there is no free wifi at this hotel if you have your own laptop they will let you borrow a network cable free of charge and you can access the internet via cable for free. The hotel information provided mentioned not to leave your towels or personal items at the swimming pool, so you can imagine our surprise when we went looking for the pool that there is no swimming pool only a spa which we did not use as you had to pay to use it. Although the beds were comfortable, we had to take our pillows down to reception and ask for them to be replaced as they smelt of tobacco smoke. I had to phone twice to check where the pillows were and then when they finally replaced them they smelt the same. After we returned them for the second time they eventually gave us a set that did not smell but felt damp as if they had just washed the pillow slips and they had not quite dried. At least they didnt smell that time. Would we stay there again? I don't think so and I probably would not recommend this hotel to anyone else. We moved to another hotel as we could only book 3 nights when we booked the hotel online as they were fully booked and I am glad we did as the hotel (H10 Villa De La Reina Hotel Madrid ) we moved to was 5 star compared to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnewfs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the metro. Note if you are using this while carrying suitcases, there are two stops. Uss the elevator where possible as they are many stairs to carry bags up or down. The location was great for exploring. The rooftop bar was an added touch. There is a large supermarket down the street- ask at the desk for directions. The staff were helpful. The hotel overall is dark. Our shower door wouldn't close and although we called the desk no one came to look or fix it. Messy.Lots of restaurants and tapas bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Views and location aside, this hotel is dinstinctly underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: RobbyBKent
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in October and were slightly disappointed with this hotel. The staff did not welcome us when we arrived and seemed bored and disinterested when checking us in, even though I made every effort to speak Spanish. We had a room on the 8th floor with a terrace. The terrace was great and south facing (especially as the weather was so hot) but it eats into the overall square footage of the room. i.e. rooms with roof terraces are tiny! You can barely walk round the bed to get to the bathroom. Room itself was clean and well maintained but unfortunately the TV didn't work properly, maybe due to the high winds we experienced. The bed was also very uncomfortable. Air con took a long time to get going. The hotel has a spa but it is €32 euros each (yes each) to use it for 1 hour!! That is outrageous. We assumed it was free as there is no mention of the charge on Expedia.co.uk whom we used to book the hotel. Location is fantastic. Right in the heart of Gran Via and easy walking distance to most major attractions like Plaza Mayor, San Miguel Market, theatres and shops. In in all, the hotel was a disappointment which was partly cancelled out by the amazing view we had from the terrace. If you are looking to book here I would say the roof terrace is the only really appealing aspect of this hotel. Other than that it is quite expensive for what is it and doesn't really feel like the 4/5 star hotel it claims to be.

Reviews.Title: “Lou & Gaye Pietracci”
Reviews.Author: Louis P
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Vincci Capitol hotel Gan Via Madrid.. Service on arrival was prompt and courteous, All staff we interacted with were friendly and helpful, and rooms were very comfortable, clean and quiet ..In addition we could not have asked for a better Location...... Overall we were very impressed and pleased with our hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, easy walking to most tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Joe_B1929
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October 2012. very close to to callao metro station, 50metres. the hotel is on the busy Gran Via road, so you are a short walk to many of the main tourist spots. Royal palace - 10mins, Plaza Mayor - 15 mins and Prado - 20 mins. the hotel itself has quite dark decor.We were on the 6th floor with no view, but enjoiyed a drink up on the sun terrace. Although next to a busy road and central we found it quiet. The staff were great. as with other reviewers the bathroom was clean and tidy, but the shower was a nightmare. Turns the bathroom into a wet room. Overall we had a great trip, great food and Madrid was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jvega1944
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from September 14 to September 17 of 2011. I have mixed feelings about this hotel, we liked some things about this hotel and disliked others. I liked the great location in the Gran Via next to the Callao metro station and within walkable distance from main tourist attractions; I also liked the staff at the front desk that was very efficient and accommodating. I also liked the size of the room and its modern decor with comfortable beds however it lacked racks for suitcases and had an extremely difficult to operate lightning system. I loved its beautiful stylish and spotless bathroom but hated the weird glass shower curtain and the coarse bath towels. I also did not like the extremely dirty balcony full of cigarette butts. When I go back to Madrid next year I could stay at this hotel again if this minor faults are corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TISPA
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for tourists, but because of the location there was traffic noise and on Saturday night there was noise from partiers. The hotel has terraces that give nice city views and is located literally across the street from a metro station. Easy walking to tapas bars and shopping, perhaps 20 minutes to the Prado. The English of the desk staff was good. The room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, but still quiet.”
Reviews.Author: patriknimmerstam
Reviews.Content: A great loacation at Gran Via, but still very quiet. Nice terrace at the roof. Rooms modern, but not always easy to understand how the lighting system works...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel bad lighting and security”
Reviews.Author: travelnow08
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it said it was 4 star. In Spain the hotels rate themselves so do not by the star rating. When we arrived we asked for a room on 9th floor it cost extra but it's worth it. It was room 901 and it had great views. Lamps in room had no bulbs. Lighting was at best dim not unlike a vampire crypt but bright burn your eyes our bathroom lights. Also at midnight the TV would just turn on and scare the daylights out of you! Their security is not very good and Madrid is high crime with a bad vibe. Within 20 mins of landing from Australia via LA I had been robbed they stole my passport and 2 credit cards! So terrible. Anyway I was in the glass elevator of the hotel a man got in on floor 4 and stayed staring at me up to floor 9. I got out so did he and he linger for me to do God knows what I was terrified pounding on my dole for my friend to let me in. Once inside I rang reception they do not speak much English. She could not understand me so did nothing. I went down again in morning and told the English speaking lady and she made some vague reference to checking security footage. She was not surprised and was totally blasé even though she did say sorry. So pluses are it's in a good location and it's clean. Bad is not many staff speak English and poor security. Also it's in a busy part of city so there are lots of beggars and homeless people cluttering up the entry to hotel and vomit as well from tourists who overdo it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but...”
Reviews.Author: iminphilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of June. The location was great in terms walking accessibility to all the major points of interests. Great restaurants and all the plazas are close by. The rooms are decent size for European standards and the service was good. Breakfast buffet had a nice assortment of foods and was plentiful. My only hesitation in recommending this hotel is that for individuals who have issues with smoking, this might no be the hotel for you. We could smell the smoke coming into our room through the venting system. If this is not an issue for you, you will like the hotel and its services.

Reviews.Title: “Just about OK”
Reviews.Author: macks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the beginning of September, having booked as a 'Top Secret' hotel on lastminute.com. They claim 4* status but they failed to live up to that expectation. The location is perfect in the centre of Madrid, with a Metro close by, but there are problems with homeless people living outside the hotel entrance. Check in was quick and functional, but like most of our staff interactions it was cold and unfriendly. Our room on the 5th floor was compact and the furnishing was showing signs of age (chips, cracks and lifting flooring) with a strong smell of stale cigarette smoke. The room lighting is a triumph of style over substance - it's in-keeping with the cinema theme of the hotel, but leads to a room and bathroom which are quite dark. The bathroom is fairly large, but the shower screen leaked badly and the shower itself was very weak and disappointing. Beds were hard and on wheels which meant some movement when you sit up in them... Some things that I would expect in a 4* hotel were missing - there is no WiFi in the room and no desk. The rooms have no tea/coffee facilities or ironing board - ironing boards were not available from reception; instead we were instructed to pay €4 per time to have them ironed. There aren't many power sockets for 21st century travellers - we only found one in the bedroom. The rooftop bar was an experience - you have to order drinks by phone and the loungers had no cushions on, despite 35C heat. Overall - an ok hotel that focusses more on style and failed to meet some of my basic expectations properly. Good if you can get it for a decent price, but definitely not worth the advertised rack rate!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SliderDublin
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel, we requested a high room with a view and we got it! It is beautifully situated on the Gran Via, right beside,the underground, bus routes and tour bus. Rooms were a reasonable size with a big modern bathroom. Serviced panoramic roof terrace with sun beds is a nice plus if you want to get a tan and shop!! Nice modern stylish hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bad services”
Reviews.Author: Eleanna G
Reviews.Content: Hotel might be in a good location but : Time of check in was approx 40 min 2 spoons to eat an ice cream where requested one evening and they charged each one for 2 euro ! one of our mobiles was forgotten behind and when we called from airport to ask a way to send us at least the sim card they refused to do so ! when our travel agency called right after to send the courier service they where told that they did nt have the mobile !! Not a cheap hotel to refuse to help their customers -.-

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern chic”
Reviews.Author: Debbie W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and it is a lovely hotel situated in the centre of Madrid - very chic and modern. My room was big and the bathroom had a fantastically big bath, which was wonderful, plus reception staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was varied and delicious. My only real criticism is that, for the business traveller, there is no desk/workstation in the bedroom (at least, there wasn't in mine). Plus to get online you have to have a cable which needs to be borrowed from reception if you don't have your own, and it took me a while to locate the access point. I also got confused by the lighting, which works on a dimmer system and so when I entered my room I only succeeded in switching all the lights off and then had to fumble in the dark to try and work out how to switch them back on!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: trip2ship
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Vincci Capital. Hotel staff was cordial upon arrival and always helpful. As with most rooms in Europe, they are not huge - but our room was clean, comfortable & well-appointed with modern decor. The location is in a convenient spot on the busy Gran Via and centrally located for walking, shopping and sightseeing. Enjoy a cocktail in the 2nd floor bar & lounge... and gaze at the spectacular view of Gran Via at night when the lights are all on! I would stay at Vincci Capital again and recommend it for one or more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great central location”
Reviews.Author: cazzaj81
Reviews.Content: The Vincci capitol is part of the chain of 'Vincci' hotels in Madrid, the Soho, via 66 and Central were all seen on our visit and all looked fab. I stayed in the Capitol for 4 nites and 3 days on a sight seeing trip. The Capitol was very close to all metro and bus routes, the Gran Via metro stop being the best route from the airport. The turistico Madrid open top bus was a short stroll along from the hotel. I arrived well after midnight on first night, staff were friendly and welcoming and no hassle at all getting into room. Room was spotless, bright, bold and modern, beds were very comfy. Cleaner came to room each day and sheets and floors etc were spotless when we came back on an evening. Visited the bar once, prices of beers a bit steep, £3.70 for a local bottle of beer. ( Top tip, buy some cans or bottles from a supermarket and use the mini bar fridge to keep them cool, great when your getting ready to go out, also take them to the floor 9 roof top viewing, perfect for a drink, the views are stunning!!!). Another tip, check out the sun terrace on floor 7, perfect viewing on an afternoon early evening, stunning views and a perfect sun trap, depending on time of year for visit! For getting around Madrid its quite easy to walk to main attractions from hotel, Sol centre (main bars and restaurants and shopping district) is moments away, as is the Bernabeu stadium, about 30 mins walk. Use the open top bus for your first day, to get your barings, around 17 euros for 1 day or 22 for a two day pass. There are some excellent tapas restaurants hidden away a few mins walk from hotel and plenty of nightlife. Also check out Retiro park, perfect place for a picnic or stroll along with an ice cream!! Lovely city, bustling, vibrant and fun. Would definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a good location on Grand Via”
Reviews.Author: andrewong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci Capitol as we had one day/night in Madrid in transit before heading to London. Was very relieved to find that the hotel was in an easily accessible location near the centre of Madrid. At first glance, you could almost miss the entrance because it was part of a theatre building and the hotel entrance is covered by darkened glass. We were delighted to find that the rooms were of a very good quality, a tad on the futuristic modern side, with glass covered wardrobes and flat screen TV. Sleep quality was excellent because we could hardly hear the sounds on the busy streets below from the 5th floor, and the blinds effectively cut out all the outside light. I'd definitely come back to stay at the Vincci Capitol again when we have more time in Madrid in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel in a Pretty Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: snv4u
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just ended our vacation to Spain with 3 nights in Madrid’s Vincci Capitol Hotel. The location was great – a short walk to restaurants, shopping, Puerto del Sol and other sites. Compared to the other hotels during our trip, this was not our favorite but it was definitely not a bad place to stay for the price. We experienced a problem with our shower door as it would not shut causing water to spill out. We informed the hotel staff and they told us that they would provide us with additional towels and send someone to fix the door. No one actually showed up so we ended up calling the front desk once we returned from dinner in the evening. Maintenance did in fact show up and graciously provided us with towels but said that unfortunately, there was no way he could fix it at that time. Well, in the end, we decided to just deal with it rather than make a big fuss. Other than this issue, we had no other problems with the room. We had been spoiled during the earlier parts of our trip at other hotels in which our room provided us with beautiful views of the city. This room did not face the city so we did not have this luxury. There was a rooftop area though which did provide aerial views of Gran Via and other parts of Madrid. We realized early on that the hotel staff were not as helpful in providing good restaurant recommendations in town. Fortunately, we had done our own research and knew where to sightsee and eat. Everything was within walking distance. We spent a great deal of time visiting Cava Baja which is a street lined with great tapas bars and restaurants, most of which were very reasonably priced (we probably tried the majority of them!). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Madrid despite the minor issues at the hotel. As the other reviews indicate, many people, including ourselves, found this hotel to be a great place to stay. By the way, for those people worried about staying on Gran Via due to the busy road and prostitution, you really don’t have anything to worry about. We barely spent any time on Gran Via except to get back to our hotel. My husband and I did not spot one single prostitute (unless they look different from those in the US!). We honestly felt pretty safe. Like any major city though, you will come across a great deal of beggars throughout Madrid. Given the state of the economy, it did not come as a surprise but was always extremely sad to see. If you have any questions/concerns about this hotel or for restaurant/sightseeing recommendations, please feel free to contact me at Sheetal.vashi@gmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel and will sure to be back and recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: d_elle13
Reviews.Content: hotel was something special. location is perfect, right next to the metro and in the heart of the central area. room was spacious, clean and modern. service was impeccable and the staff were friendly and helpful. I will be sure to be back there and would recommend it to all those visiting Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “this is my second time @ this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aisha A
Reviews.Content: i like this hotel because of the location ... it is located in the middle of gran via in very nice street where all the atraction is near for example the touristic bus is stop directly opposit to the hotel door + varity of resturant + it takes around 10 min to go to real palace by walking + it has free in room internet but i think the hotel rooms need litle update .

Reviews.Title: “definitely use again perfect location”
Reviews.Author: calamityjane1953
Reviews.Content: apart from a few hiccups regarding our booking... we booked 3 nights and they had us down for only 1 night...and then cancelled our keys twice...the room was of a good standard and large size especially for the special rate we paid. We did not eat in the hotel (breakfast was 15 euros). There are many very good cafes and restaurants on the Via to be able to get a good breakfast for less than 5 euros. The bar was extremely expensive. Have a drink elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: FlixynTed
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Vincci Capitol several times both for business and pleasure. The location is absolutely perfect - close to Sol, Plaza Mayor, Chueca etc... The design touches are typically modern Spanish - quite funky. The standard rooms are perfectly adequate in size, the bed is comfortable and even the rooms facing Gran Via (busy pretty much 24hrs) are very quiet. The hotel breakfast is very good with a lot of choice and at €15 , fairly reasonable for a 4 star hotel breakfast. The terrace on floor 7 is fantastic for an evening drink / chilling and offers spectaular views across Madrid. (The larger rooms on floor 9 have private balconys and are awsome for those who want to splash out a little) Staff is overall very helpful and friendly and the hotel offers absolute value for money. The only negatives of this hotel are: -No free Wifi in hotel , but free with a cable happily provided by reception (this seems pretty standard in Madrid hotels) - No desk in standard room to work at - only a very small armchair. - Very small lobby area In summary - this hotel offers great service, comfort, modern design at a really good price. I will definitely stay here next time .

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Madrid.....”
Reviews.Author: Fidelma10
Reviews.Content: ... so it was walking distance to everything (which was fantastic), but so are any number of other hotels nearby. What made this special was the deco decor and the terraces. My room didn't have a private terrace, but there are a couple of ones residents can access which provide amazing views across the city. There is also a solarium - again with stunning views. The only thing that let it down slightly was the surly receptionist, who did little to make me feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, walk to everything!”
Reviews.Author: David_SD
Reviews.Content: (actual stay was May 2009, but review only allowed July 2010 and recent) Located in Calloa, this hotel was perfect for me as I traveled alone and preferred not to have to rent a car. Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, El Palacio Royal...everything, plus shopping...walking distance from the hotel (even, dare I say, two Starbucks locations closeby). Very small but accommodating room. Somewhat modern/contemporary. The only challenge I had was that since I was staying there a full week, it is their policy to have you pay in full after 3 or four nights, then pay the remainder upon check out. Kind of strange and inconvenient, but worth noting. It was my first time in Madrid so I'd say this hotel was ideal for that.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel brilliant views over Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Rosie91
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fab location near eateries, plazas and metro stations. Great seating area on 9th floor to see views over Madrid. Asked for high room and got one on 9th floor. Room had all you needed for your stay and staff friendly. We were overcharged by taxi on way so make sure you ask the price - shouldn't be more that 40 euros. Metro good alternative and v. cheap

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayvers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the Easter week and were extremely pleased that we picked this hotel (with very little research). Despite being in an older building (a Madrid landmark in its own right), the hotel is very modern. The room was very clean although small (but typical for Europe). The food in the restaurant was great. As an added bonus, the hotel is energy efficient, with motion detectors activating hallway lights for example. The view of Gran Via from the 9th floor patio was a nice side benefit as well. The entrance to the metro is right outside the door, as are theatres and many shops. Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Teatro Real and the Palacio Real are easily within walking distance. Although it has an extremely central location in Madrid (read: lots of people and cars until the early hours of the morning), we had no noise problems or no problem sleeping, and we were on the 4th floor (but not on the Gran Via side, perhaps that helped). The layout of the hotel (V shaped) also helps keep the noise down since there are fewer people in the hallways (since each wing only has access to a small numer of rooms). In summary, we would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful building”
Reviews.Author: Campanu
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to stay in this hotel because of the art-deco building, and once I had a chance to stop in Madrid for one night, I booked myself and my associate a couple of rooms. Location is great if you know where you are. If you don't, be aware of night life in the Gran Via, not always the most attractive or convenient. Still, it is downtown and walking distance to old Madrid, which is good. However, no parking in the hotel and most important, no real place to stop the car and leave your bags, making the arrival a bit difficult. Honestly, I cannot understand this point as I guess most of the people is arriving by car (own car or taxi). Still, there are some parkings nearby, so no worries of leaving your car outside. However, the one I selected was really tight. Rooms are of an average size with usual amenities/facilities and usual bedding, nothing special. Bathrooms small, as usually happens in this kind of hotels, didn't really like it. Sleeping quality can be disturbed by the noise of the street, even when staying in high floors. My room had no proper desk to work. Breakfast quite normal, nothing to be excited about. The decoration of the corridors is fantastic, the staircase is lovely and the elevators are perfectly mixed with the whole package. Really, if you like this style, the hotel is worth a visit. But, still, is nothing really so wonderful. Best part is the view from the top floor terrace, gives the opportunity to take great pictures. After all, you get what you pay for. With the choice of hotels in Madrid, again, select this if location and offer is suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Diego_Caeiro
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the vincci capitol in june 2010, It is a good hotel with a lot of facilities, and also the staff is very nice and helpful. Rooms are a bit small (for a 4 star hotel) but very modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place! Great location, walking distance to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Virrvarr
Reviews.Content: This 4* hotel situated in the best location possible provide you with everything you need for a great visit to the spanish capital. Although the lightning in the room was difficult to control the room was perfect; quiet, clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was good but not worth the extra 15€ per person (if not booked in advance). I will stay here the next time i visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great news upon check-in”
Reviews.Author: Max_M84
Reviews.Content: Visited Madrid for one night. As it was my first time in the city in years, I tried to put "location first". All of the Vincci hotels appeared to be attractive. Agreed on Vincci Capitol quite quickly - basing it on the interior design that seemed the best match for us. Upon arrival, I found out that we got a free upgrade to the Junior Suite (room #903). With the great views from the balcony/terrace and a spacious room, there wasn't much more to ask for. Especially that it all came free of charge! A surprise I haven't experience for quite some time. The location and modern interior design are the biggest assest of the hotel. Not to make it absolutely perfect, I would say that the leakage stain which we had on our ceiling (see my pictures) should be taken care of asap - especially that it's right above the bed. The breakfast also misses a bit of a depth when it comes to the choice of foods.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Maherz
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three days in November 2010 and it was just great. Modern and clean rooms and very central. Close to all Madrid attractions and there is Metro stop (Callao) just in front of the hotel entrance. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Location. All you can ask for”
Reviews.Author: theboysi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly helpful front desk. Paid supplement for terrace, which was well worth it. Large terrace and on 8th floor, so had great views overlooking Gran Via. Very clean, and cleaned everyday. Ideal location, right beside Metro, Tourist Info Booth, and only a 5 min walk from Plaza Mayor and Plaza Sol. Couldnt recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!!! nice location!!!! amazing room with the best view!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chrismad_80
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner visited Madrid for 7 days and half of them we stayed at Vincci Capito hotel,, The hotel is located at the best area for visiting madrid !!! Right on Gran Via,,, next to the callao metro station and so close to all tourist attractions!!! Hotel`s facillities are all stylish and modern decoreted!!!! We stayed at the junior suite on 12th floor( room1201) and the room was just FANTASTIC!!! The best room of hotel with comfortable king size bed, private elevator!! open bathroom with jacuuzi,, teracce and BREATHTAKING 360o VIEW !!!!! YES this room has one of the best panoramic views of madrid. we spent a lot of hours in the room and we really enjoyed it!!!! How ever there are some things we didn`t like at all..... STAFF.... Some of them were not so hospitable and polite, espsecially the man at the breakfast was found rude with ironic attitude,,, also it`s UNACCEPTABLE for this category of hotel,,. that the waitresses of room service not to speak english.. the breakfast was poor for this price and the room service is not 24 hours( at 23:00 we couldn`t find a glass of milk..... ) By the way we had a very good time at Vincci Capitol and i would recomend this hotel.. If you are able to spend money..... choose the junior suite on 12th floor,,, it really worths it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: Oslo1212
Reviews.Content: Stayd here in July. Very nice room, very calm to be on the Grand Via..... great location, close to shopping aereas and restaurants. Very nice breakfast. Good choise in Madrid!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...... Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: emmarkIreland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed at the Vincci Capitol for 4 nights( thurs 27th - 31st of jan) and when we arrived at the hotel we had to wait about 10-15 mins while the not so friendly receptionist checked us in. The hotel itself is well decorated and and quiet modern but it does need a little attention. For example the bathroom door in our bedroom would not close fully and water leaked from under the bath when using the shower. There was also buzzing noise coming from the electrical service box in the room which was a bit annoying at night. We had asked for a double bed when booking and got two large sized single beds pushed together. One last thing which was annoying was that there was no iron available, although there was an ironing service in the hotel but i do not know the cost of this as we just bought a travel iron from a nearby store. I do stress that although i have listed a few problems they are all very very minor details which did not come between us enjoying our trip. The cleaning staff could not have done a better job every morning when cleaning our room and the hotels location along with its views from the rooftop are second to none. Hope this review helps!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL, EXCELLENT LOCATION,EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Antonis2
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location,Excellent Service

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NoxieJ
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with amazing rooms. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. Very helpful staff. The location is also amazing. Can't fault this place!.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location, fair for the price”
Reviews.Author: Garfster_SE1
Reviews.Content: This is a decent enough hotel situated right on the busy Gran Via directly next to Callao metro station - its excellent soundproofing blocked out all the street noise. Nothing is particularly outstanding about this hotel but everything seems to work well - reading tripadvisor comments led me to expect design and comfort standards below what one would be led to believe from the hotel website. My only real grumble though was that the chocolates and sparking wine ordered for arrival were not in our room and had to be requested - when I pointed this out to room service an apology would have been preferable to a cursory "no problem" as if it was my fault, by the time they arrived we had already been out for lunch. Reception staff were fine, nothing out of the ordinary - unlike the genuine warmth exhibited by staff at the Senator Gran Via I used on my previous visit to Madrid. Rooms were perhaps on the small side but for a two nights' stay served my purpose. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: smilley004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this weekend with my boyfriend and was so disappointed as had been looking forward to it for a long time, it had cost a lot and we were celebrating an anniversary. From start till end of our trip we were disappointed, firstly we arrived and were not so much a greeted than grunted at by a very unpleasant desk clerk. Then the room was so badly furnished it was like the rooms were rushed to get finished. The shower leaked all over the place which was not only uncomfortable but very dangerous with all the electrical equipment and sockets in the bathroom. There are no mirrors in the bedroom, only in the bathroom which makes getting ready with more than one person an annoyance, and the lighting was so bad. The hotel really felt as if it was thrown together, the lifts were also slow and you could be waiting a long time for one. Then when I was packing to leave I discovered that a brand new ( unopened ) bottle of perfume I had purchased from the duty free on the way over, was gone. The cleaner or another member of staff must have taken this. Having paid €70 for this I was very annoyed. Not only to know someone was rooting through my luggage but also that when I reported this at reception they were no help at all, took down no information or helped me or offered me compensation. I was told “ I must have left the room open” with tears in my eyes and left and finished up my weekend very upset. I would go back to Madrid, but definitely not this hotel, location is good and that is the only thing it has going for it, there are plenty of hotels in the area thou.DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the pricer”
Reviews.Author: MadridOrmondBeach
Reviews.Content: When we arrived I immediately asked for another nights stay, which was not a problem. Our room was not ready, the desk clerk said she would give us an upgrade for the same price. The room was very nice, actually it was a suite. Everything was clean with a wonderful view from our windows. Would definately stay again and also strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitly recommend”
Reviews.Author: IDTravells
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel through Booking.com and after reading Trip's reviews. I must say the Location is Great, in one of the most emblematic buildings of Gran Via and just in the middle of everything! The rooms are just the right size and with a very comfy yet modern look. Large double bed and pillow menu. Not a great view (interior pateo) but not really needed if you walk around madrid all day and just want to rest! Check out the terrace for great views. The bathroom is also modern, the only problem being the leaky shower (floods the floor). I recommend using the bath even just for showering or else you'll run out of towels just to keep the floor walkable... Did not try the breakfast because I thought 30€/day for a couple is just a "bit" on the expensive side... Instead, we went for starbucks just around the corner. you should also try the tipical madrid breakfast (hot chocolate and churros). Staff were friendly and everything went smoothly (keep an eye for your luggage if you leave it at the hotel before or after check-in or check out. ours was mixed up but everything was solved in 5 minutes). Overall I definitely recommend Vincci Capitol - location, cleanliness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: hellybel
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 10th floor overlooking the Madrid skyline. The room had very little storage (a small wardrobe and a couple of drawers) but had a huge comfortable bed and great double glazing so we never heard the traffic outside.The only thing that let it down were the poor bedside lamps. They were impossible to read by. We didn't use the spa or have breakfast at the hotel as we felt they were overpriced. We would def. use this hotel again because it was so central. Just a short walk in each direction to the major attractions and so easy to reach by metro from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Gringopr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located to all the sights on the main shopping boulevard. Rooms are in a modern style with Ikea furniture. The bathroom is quite large and easy a third of the whole room. The only issues I had with the room was that the glass counter in the bathroom was cracked and the sink is modern and does not have a design to drain well. Not that it was a problem but there was no wifi in the rooms. The staff was very helpful when I first arrived but deteriorated during the stay. The metro is right outside the door, so it really is all about location. As for resteraunts in the area you are better off going to the little plaza like Santa Ana to get the atmosphere of being in Spain, although there are some great places on Gran Via for tapas. It is a modern (neat elevator), clean, and centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, great value”
Reviews.Author: FashionAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I am quite often in Madrid and could not find a better hotel to stay for that money and location. At the heart of Gran Via and everything is just a few minutes away - regardless if it is a business stay or leasure! Rooms are ok, staff is great just talk to them and they give you all the "Madrid secret places" to see and go to. Try not to get a room at the back, the cinema can be quite loud and I was "enjoying" an entire film beeing able to listen to every word.... however, the front part was always great!!! Will go back the next time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good, but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: MiguelRamirez
Reviews.Content: Pros: very good location, you exit the metro at Callao stop and you are about 30 meters from the entrance right at the main street of Gran Via. Very centric with everything close by. Elevators are good and the decoration is modern and nice. Cons: Breakfast not included, it costs 15 euro per person. Bathroom looks nice but is not very practical. Internet service is clumsy until you are told all the tricks to make it work. It was summer, and the AC disconnects when you go out, so the room is pretty hot when you get back. At night the AC was too cold, no matter how you program it. Big Con: My wife is missing a Belt she bought, we think the room service maid took it, so we did not let them make our room on the last night.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking spot right in the middle”
Reviews.Author: coldon602
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location right at the heart of the shopping district with a Metro station literally at its back door. Room was clean and neat with air conditioning that didn't keep us awake all night. Only problem was each day after 12 our key cards had to be reprogrammed and the shower leaked. Apart from that no problems. Staff had good english and the Balcony on the 9th floor has a view of Madrid second to none. No street noise as all the rooms are well soundproofed. All in all a great place to stay. Will definitely stay there again. Only other thing I would say is that WiFi is badly missed...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ENikolaou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location in Madrid. The staff was very friendly, helpful and propably the only people in Madrid who speak english. The room was clean and modern. The bathroom was spacious. The TV has a variety of channels. The internet is free of charge. You can borrow an ethernet cable from the reception. The breakfast could be better. There are plenty of shops and restaurants just outside the hotel. There is a supermarket in a department store opposite the hotel. You can easily walk to a lot of attractions. There is a metro line opposite the hotel which makes a stop anywhere in Madrid, so get a map. Don't miss the Mercato, the Palacio de Real and the Retiro park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT.......”
Reviews.Author: Gibano
Reviews.Content: if you are OK with a hotel that does NOT pay attention to cleaning details, then this hotel will be perfect for you. Our TV never worked correctly but our A/C worked very well. The doors next to us when slammed shut maked a very loud noise. Another couple that was traveling with us decided to go check into the Westin hotel because their shower stall floor was very filthy and had a terrible odor coming out of it. The hotel's response was as if they did not care. Our carpet looked as though it had never been vacuumed. Overall this was strange two night visit in Madrid mainly because of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, uncomfortable room”
Reviews.Author: jaybee1944
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located well, near the tourist attractions and restaurants, but the staff is not trained for the foreing tourist. The room I got in the 8th floor was narrow, could not walk to the washroom, the courtains did not work, TV was not visible from the bed and the chairs were made for midgets(so small). It had a nice balcony with a great view. For a couple of nights is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: 2FunTrippers
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to its reputation! We were in a standard Room-704. Small but efficient. There is a closet, safe, bar fridge and shelving on one side of the room, all lit with overhead lights. Upon entering the room, the lights are turned on by inserting the door card into a slot. As is common in most Vincii hotels, the decor is modern and stylish-stainless and wood. The bath is compact and the door gets in the way. After a couple of days, we adjusted to the size of the room and bath. Our window faced a side street although we could see the plaza and a wonderful view of the city. We didn't spend any time on the patio which is also on the 7th floor. The street noise was minimal except for Saturday night when the young crowd was roaming the streets. There are 3 elevators and almost always there is one waiting for use. The beds were so comfortable which was great after a day of walking around downtown and standing in the museums, plazas and parks. The location is perfect. The staff at the reception desk is very pleasant and helpful, especially Severine in the afternoon and Cristina in the day. Plaza Callao is outside the door as is the Gran Via, Metro and numerous bus lines. We didn't do the hotel breakfast at 15 euros per person. Th bar/dining area is beautifully decorated but there are plenty of eateries for breakfast right outside the door. Our favorites were Pain Quotidien and VIPS, both just steps away from the front door. The Plazas are great places for walking, seeing and being seen. If you find you forgot something, there is a department store/supermarket on the plaza. We got water, soda and juices to keep in the room bar fridge. Do take advantage of the MetroCard. We used AeroCity to get to the hotel when we arrived. There was a mix-up and we waited about 45 minutes for our transportation. Finally we were picked up by a very nice and apologetic driver to refused a tip because of our inconvenience. On departure, we took the Metro to the airport. It was not at all difficult but be sure to get directions and a map. It was a much better trip. We travel light so we only had one roll bag and that helped because at one station there were steps to climb. Our only regret was we didn't stay long enough.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed stay here”
Reviews.Author: amykff
Reviews.Content: i was really surprised by this hotel, i wasnt expecting it to be as nice as it was. the lobby is small but well done...staff at reception were very helpful and had fluent english which was nice because the language barrier was very difficult everywhere else! the location can't be beat walking distance to everything, shops, restaurants and bars on the doorstep and all major attractions are a few mins walk away!! i was really impressed with the room. although it wasnt huge it was perfectly formed with loads of wardrobe space etc. the bathroom was gorgeous aswell with a powerful shower!! loads of options on the tv for movies and news channels in each language and they werent too dear either! breakfast was a little pricey but well worth it they really lay it on! the only complaint i had about this hotel is minor....there was no iron in the room or available for rent from reception...they do have a dry cleaning service where you can get your clothes ironed but i wouldnt pay 20euro for someone to iron a few clothes...just ensure you bring a travel iron!! the bar in the hotel was quiet when we were there but it was decorated well and was very comfortable...not the cheapest though! all in all i coldnt have been happier with the hotel and would definitley return in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location, excellent facilities, good value and...”
Reviews.Author: interpolation
Reviews.Content: ...interesting service. This hotel was absolutely perfect for my partner and I. The location, on the Gran Via, was so central I don't think anything else would have done as well for us. It was in the immediate vicinity of three metro lines and within immediate walking distance of major sights - Sol, Plaza Mayor, obviously Gran Via itself, Plaza Espana etc. Within a 10 minute walking distance were Malasana, Chueca and Los Austrias/La Latina and within a 20 minute walking distance were the Prado and the other museums on the Passeo. From this perspective, it was perfect. The architecture of the building is iconic to the city - the building was featured on the advertising for the celebrations related to the 100th anniversary of the Gran Via. The building's interiors were obviously recently refurbished but many of its original features were left in tact. Each floor maintained a 1930's-style design aesthetic with original plans and layouts for the building displayed in the newer elevator lobby. The interior was light and open. We were on the 7th floor, facing the interior courtyard and which featured a "solarium" looking out over old Madrid - basically a terrace with some lounge chairs, tables and showers should guest wish to tan. There was a 9th floor look out over the Gran Via as well which was popular in the evenings. The facilities, including the solarium and terrace, were amazing and provided for a good respite from the bustle of the city. The hotel was quiet despite being on the Gran Via. However, other items (massage room, sauna, restaurant etc) were no included in our hotel stay but looked nice. The restaurant was nicely designed and fit the look of the hotel. Overall, the location and design were very adequate for what we were looking for. A definite plus if you plan to party - Malasana, Chueca and the other parts of Old Madrid were in walking distance and right on the metro. There were some "kinks" that made us wonder, however. The room did not include a WiFi connection; internet access was offered via an Ethernet cable which was to be provided but never came, despite a second call to reception. By coincidence, we brought our own and ended up using it. As a business hotel, there was some other oddities - no desk for your laptop, but plenty of well designed but not so functional night-stand type tables were available in our room. Nonetheless, the layout was perfect - bright, plenty of closest space and a tasteful, large bathroom. The fixtures were very chic (-though, the side mirror was placed at chest level - I am only 5'8 - and I could only see my shoulders when looking into it; it couldn't move up or down nor could it be tilted; however, if you're 5'5, you're in luck!). We had a "King Bed", in reality, two queens put together, which wasn't conducive to, well, things one may partake in otherwise. These, however, were very minor oddities and should not be deterrents to staying in this hotel which honestly was great. The only complaint of merit would be the service. I understand that this is a Spanish chain and am very happy to learn a little bit of the local language when travelling (and am very happy I did), because on certain days and times no staff member spoke English. Despite asking politely in Spanish if the reception staff spoke English, several times there was confusion about what I was asking. At one point when asking for a cork screw for wine we purchased, I was referred to the restaurant, whose staff told me I had to come down to the first floor to get the corkscrew. When I appeared, they told me I had to go get the bottle and bring it down to have it unscrewed! Luckily for me, I was happy enough to have avoided the volcano mess and was in a good mood because otherwise it was insanely bizarre to me to have had to go through such trouble in a four star hotel. If I was in a family B&B, I would have understood this, but here? Weird! Nonetheless, every other interaction was prompt and courteous, though we figured out how to ask for ice in Spanish and it was all well and good! The staff also don't bother you when coming in and out of hotels, though if you have a friend calling or visiting, they sure do like to question them. Despite this oddity in service, we still had an excellent experience and, hey, learned a few extra words in Spanish. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Central location in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: bluenose777
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for the location alone, with most of the major sights within walking distance. The room was clean and modern and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would definately stay at this hotel again if i was to come back to Madrid.
