When you are in Madrid i would recommend using the Metro because it is only 1euro for a single journey and it is a very fast,safe and efficent way of getting anywhere around the city. Also a trip to Madrid wouldn't be complete without visiting the Santiago Bernabau- the home of Real Madrid football team. They have a nice resonably priced cafe overlooking the pitch and then maybe you could then you could do the stadium tour or if you are lucky enough to get tickets you should definately watch them play. The royal place is also worth a visit but be warned you are not allowed to take photos! The Reina Sofia museum is where some of picasso's work is kept on display and is also worth a visit and is free if you go on a sunday. The Madrid vision bus tour is good value for money but really this is a city you can explore on foot and is not really essential once you have realised how close everything is. There is also an excellent shop called O2 near to the hotel which is a really smart modern shop which sells all sorts of interesting items.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful art deco hotel with excellent, friendly service"”
Reviews.Author: Leena1626
Reviews.Content: Thanks for all the staff in Vincci for helping us with our luggage problems and for helping us to find the right places in Madrid. We really felt at home in Vincci.

Reviews.Title: “great pied-a-terre in Madrid but forget about wifi, room service and extras”
Reviews.Author: ernestjames
Reviews.Content: rooms are modern minimalist, all nice design, but no creature comforts location is superb if you like walking around the center of Madrid, to theatres and shops in Gran Via, Plaza Sol etc we paid EUR 85 for 1 double room booked last minute mid-week as we decided on an impromptu stay v good overall, but you have to pay to have music/TV.. and never even tried the wifi because it was offered by that antiquated tv keyboard system this would not be a good business hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Madrid, in an Art Deco masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: ZanetCal
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfirend for a Valentine's break, and loved the location - easy reach for Old and Bourbon Madrid, along with the more lively Fuencarral area... Its only 5 minutes from Puerto del Sol, which is a major pedestrian hub . Great shopping, restaurants and nightlife is on the doorstep. Sure, the rooms are small, and the lighting is a littel understatged, but the decor is pretty funky, and buy a postcard - how many hotels are in the majority of postcards for any holiday destination?? Great for a quick, unpretentious and unique break, but not top-specced in terms of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: guiritraveller
Reviews.Content: small yet smart room, chipped bath in bathroom, a tv set that seemed determined to make me pay for programmes, electrics that buzzed all night and a 'wifi' that was a cable to plug into the computer, combined with a 'no ironing board' policy leading to an irate conversation to get a shirt ironed at 7:30am made this an uncomfortable and unsatisfactory stay. when picking my bags up later in the day they had been thrown around the storage area and the staff were not aware of the names of streets just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Dark depressing rooms, Terrible Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miamiviajera
Reviews.Content: Poorly lit rooms, no desk, uncomfortable Internet access, spotty room service make this a terrible choice for the business traveler. Compound that with a very, very surly front desk receptionist (Sara) who whose total lack of understanding of the word "service" undermined an otherwise friendly staff, and you have a loser hotel. When I asked for an adaptor, I had to go downstairs to pick it up. This is a four star hotel??There is no light in the bathroom; impossible to get makeup on. Rooms are dark. INternet access is far from the bed. No wireless. No adaptors if you're from out of Spain (had to go purchase one at Corte INgles). Rough towels. Sporadic room service. NO gym. ON the plus sign, amenities include toothbrushes and tooth paste. but hey. I can get those when I buy the adaptor. I'll never return to this depressing place.

Reviews.Title: “Horroible stay”
Reviews.Author: mrijay
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of staying here again beause I got a good deal. I thought, after reading reviews, that the hotel is now better. but it is as bad as ever. Only the location is good. The hotel staff are outright rude and disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Found this hotel to be a great gem”
Reviews.Author: lafeamasbella
Reviews.Content: This place to me was absolutely a gem. Location is the key with this, which is right on the Gran Via- close to tons of places to see and of course stores to go shopping. Train is right around the corner, bus stops in front! if you decide to take the bus tour, stop is also in the front. the room was great, shelves to put items away, fridge to store items from the store like drinks or fruit i bought from el corte ingles market. many of sights to see walking along the streets, the beautiful baroque styling. i was surprised to see that i had a balcony! open up the doors and had a view to the street, quiet and had a beautiful view at night of a spanish sunset. my room was on the 8th floor, the 7th has a solarium to have some drinks & dinner, lounge and read a book. the 9th floor has a view on the other side of the street which is on the Gran Via, nice pic opportunity. I know i had a great time at this hotel, will definitely be back to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the stars and price.”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo15
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated as 4 star, but this only applied to its location and price, otherwise it was a standard 3 star. It is centrally located with an incredible number of bars, restaurants and cafes situated nearby with the Plaza Mayor less than 10 minutes away The hotel staff were really friendly and suggested quality restaurants (thanks Severine) located nearby. Their english was a lot better than my spanish. The room was clean enough although several of the fixtures in the en suite bathroom were rather loose. There was also the impression when we first went in that somebody had been smoking in the room and it hadn't been aired properly. Despite requesting a king sized bed in the room we were presented with twin beds which moved around if you sat down on them too heavily. The room had a mini bar, the contents of which were quite pricey and were not used. The room also lacked any coffee making facilities which would have made a difference. There were other amenities in the hotel but we didn't use them as they appeared overpriced in an already expensive capital city. Unfortunately, there were a lot of building works going on and around the hotel as well as the rest of the city, but thankfully being on the 8th floor and with double glazing there was little noise intrusion. We didn't hear any noise from any of the other rooms even though there were a fair number of people going around. We arrived on a Wednesday which was the most expensive night out of our 3 nights, so if you want a cheaper stay at this hotel, make sure it's over the weekend. I would recommend the hotel to friends but thay must bear in mind the above proviso's.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service, bellow average hotel”
Reviews.Author: eparty69
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 2 occassions (2008 & 2009) for a total of 4 weeks. The hotel rates itself as 4 star however the service is within the 1 star category. The last time I arrived, I left my bags at front desk and waited for them to be delivered. After waiting for sometime, I fell asleep. Awoke 30 min later and the bags were still not up. Called downstairs and was told to come down and get them myself if I need them quickly. Gee....like 30 min wait was not enough. Dropped dry cleaning off on Monday....2 days later it was not back, yet I did not receive even a call. When I called downstairs, I was told, "Tomorrow." Every second day, your access card for the door gets deactivated. The hotel staff blames it on the guests, "Oh, it is because you carry it beside your cell phone.", "Oh..it is because you kept it with your credit cards." And listen to the best one, "It is because you went to a department store and the anti-theft system deactivated it.". After the second deactivation it becomes so annoying to have to wait for the elevators, go to your room and then find that you cannot get in and to have to go downstairs again. Since we stayed for a 2 week period, after the first week the system deactivated my card because they wanted me to go to front desk and leave a bigger deposit on my card. After complaining that following a 12 hr day at the office, the last thing I want to do is go to my room and find that I cannot get in, I was told that "The staff prefers to speak to us face to face when it comes to putting another hold on my card" Duhhhh.....don't you think that there are better ways to discuss matters like this - like giving me call! I annoyingly told them that they can put whatever hold they want on my card and left. 15 min later I call front desk to have them connect mem to another room. Same employee I spoke to earlier instead of fulfilling my request decides that first thing he should tell me that my card is getting declined. I reply that it is their system, he insists it is my card and if I don't have another card I should put deposit in cash. At this point I am super annoyed and told her that I do not wanna discuss this and want to be connected to the other room. To make the long story short, I spent 15 min on the phone with AmEx and there were no issues with my card. The rooms are dark & do not have even a small working desk. Network jack for the internet is stuck in a corner, so if you need to work, your only option is to sit like a caveman in a cornet on a tiny coffee table and a bad soft cushion chair - definitely a no for a business traveller. Bathroom toiletries are sub-par, very weird and uncomfortable hanging rack for shirts and jackets. According to my co-workers, quality of room service food is poor. Bed is comfortable but the majority of the rooms have double beds so if you are with a wife/girlfriend/boyfriend and want to get closer, please mind the gap! Another annoying thing is that all electric sockets are connected to the room key-card reader, so if you go out and want in the mean time to charge your camera batteries or electric shaver, you cannot do that because there will be no AC/DC. Tried leaving my key in the reader and using my second card for entry, however room service knew better and collected my card key. Only good thing in the room is the fairly large fridge where I could keep drinks, fruits, etc. Overall my advice is to avoid this hotel if you are planning to live in it for more than 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: coca
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel for a city break in Madrid. The location is really the best you can get. It is located on the Gran Via which offers a lot of shopping and cafes and a very easy walking distance to Puerta del Sol, the centre of Madrid. You could walk easily also to the old part, Plaza Mayor and around as well as to Plaza Santa Ana. A metro stop is located right outside the door. Rooms are quite modern and fresh, though on the small side with regards to size. However we had room for everything as we were not carrying a lot of luggage. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuyGirl
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is in the centre of Madrid and next to Metro station. The rooms were really nice, modern and comfortable. It takes a couple of minutes to work out how the lights work. The staff were very helpful and speak English. One night we had a power cut in our room, I phoned reception and a repairman came up straight away. it wasn't until after he left that we realised the time. It was midnight so it really was good service! The hotel bar is very nice. A beer and a glass of red wine cost just over 7 euros. Which we thought was fine. The rooms are very quiet and you cannot hear any of the outside noise. We did however hear other guests letting their doors slam every now and then but it didn't really bother us. The area is wonderful and lively and is near lots of bars and restaurants. We definately want to stay here again! Even though there are loads of people around and this area is busy there are a lot of prostitutes in the area day and night, particularly in Calle de la Montera, which is a pedestrianised street near hotel. We didn't feel threatened at all, we just got used to it and enjoyed watching them in the end. Tips: We used the metro a few times. The ticket machine has an English language option we got a 10 trip ticket which we shared and it cost around 7.50 euros otherwise it is 1 euro per journey. If you decide to go to Botin restaurant, the worlds oldest restaurant which is in most guide books and in the guiness book of records then we recommend you book your table as it gets very busy. We asked the reception staff to book it for us. We had their set menu 40.20 euros Gazpacho Soup, Roast Suckling Pig, Ice Cream and 1/2 bottle wine per person. Delicious! If you decide to go to Toledo, be aware that the train get's full very quickly. We aimed to get the 10.20 train and we arrived at about 9.45 and it had sold out the next one was at 12.20 and took this train and at the time of booking you have to decide on what time train you are returning on too. Toledo is lovelly but there is a lot of steps to go up to get to the village. On a hot day it is a little tiring. We went to a bullfight. The stadium is right next to the metro station. The bullfighting is very popular and there was about 20,000 people there when we went and then of course a mad rush for the metro station afterwards. In the stadium We sat at the top in the shade and our tickets cost 7 euros each. Where we sat the seats are concrete steps. half of the step is for the person's feet behind you and the other half is for your backside it wasn't comfortable. There are cushions to hire. If you pay more then you may get a more comfortable step to sit on but our seats were the best in the end because it rained and all of the people in the good seat s at the front got wet. Prepare yourself, bullfighting isn't for the faint hearted. I did find it upsetting. It would probably be helpful to read up on bullfighting before you go so you can understand what's going on and prepare yourself on what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location amazing price amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: mbilal84
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect package!! You get everything for such a low cost. i was scared at first when i booked it for under $90.. but when i arrived there i was shocked.. its more like a 5 star to me.. the location is just perfect.. its about a 30 minute cab ride from the airport and thats the only painful part which cost me almost 30 euros one way.. there is not other way unless you want to take the metro but expect to take about 1.5 hours.. i didnt want to drag my luggage around changing 2-3 metro lines.. but thats ok.. honestly the rooms have amazing decor and setup.. as you walk in your first impression would "WOW". The washrooms are well kept and there is a jacuzzi.. the rooms are very modern and look literally brand new. Its a very stylish hotel with an amazing location. shopping centres are within minutes of walk and many restaurants on the street. Its fully lives till late night. Free high speed internet. Front staff was polite and helpful and speak fluent english. Would i stay here again? without a second thought YES I WOULD!! i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nak80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the center of Madrid, on Gran Via (which is one of the main streets). There are a LOT of restaurants, cafes, shops, etc. in the area. The hotel is very close to almost everything in Madrid - we didn't have to use public transportation except for a few times. The room was a bit small, but charmingly decorated, very clean and pretty quiet (taking into account the location of the hotel). The room had a TV, a minibar and a free safe. It was possible to purchase Internet access for an extra fee (we didn't). The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and had a hair dryer. The hotel provides various bathroom amenities like soap, shampoo, shower gel, toothbrush, comb... The hotel staff is very professional, friendly, nice and helpful. The breakfast buffet was very good and had something for everyone. We very much enjoyed the stay and would definately consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: vogue1122
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at this Hotel and have to say, it was wonderful. The location is slap bang in the middle of everything so all you need is totally just outside the door. The Hotel harks back to the 40's era but all done with a modern twist. The staff could not do enough for us and accommodated our every need. The room (we had a superior) which I would recommend spending the difference on (did get a sneak view of the regular room and not as grand as the superior)The room was large, with windows all around, you can take a bath looking out at the city lights, big floor to ceiling curtains all the way round, lighting on a system that you can set the mood perfectly for a romantic evening in together or Wembly Stadium if you need it. Would whole heartedly recommend booking a Superior Room for a weekend with your loved one, to relax, enjoy the city and each other...... (I travel the world with my job and believe me I know good Hotel when I stay in one!!)

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel, worst staff!”
Reviews.Author: tazHouston
Reviews.Content: Aside from being small and stuffy, this hotel left a bruise on my foot after the heavy knob of the shower fell on my foot our first day there! There was too many unnecessary clutter around the room which made it feel smaller, however, essentials like soap and towels were hard to come by. Aside from one receptionist (who is french) the staff was rude, unhelpful, and unapologetic for a big oversight. We had requested a wakeup call on the day of our departure and did not get one! When asked why, the front desk clerk nonchalantly said "you are not on my list.." and went about her business. When we emailed the hotel about our concerns, we did not even get an acknowledgment. I will never return to this hotel or any of its chains.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: LondonPudner
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Vincci Capitol with a large group of friends as we were in Madrid for a wedding. I have to say, based on reviews on this site I had a mixed opinion before going, but having stayed there I would definitely go back. The staff were very helpful (booking restaurants) and very friendly, and were very accomodating in having us all on the same floor etc. The rooms were spacious and clean (although the storage was quite limited) and the bathroom was ideal. One of our party had a slightly bigger room (facing the inside of the hotel) and their room was much more spacious and they had a seperate shower/bath, but all in all it was ideal for our requirements. It is right on the Gran Via and within walking distance of all the areas you would want to visit. There is also a Taxi rank right outside the front door. The sun terrace is lovely and took advantage and popped to the local supermarket and got supplies for a mini picnic in the sunshine. The only note of caution I would add would be in relation to the bar. It was very expensive (€10 for a vodka and diet coke). Granted the measures were HUGE, but a quick walk will bring you to a local bar where the drinks are half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: AVMAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. This place is not the cheapest in the world, but we thought it was great, location was great, staff were extremely helpful. Not only are you in the heart of Madrid on Gran Via, you are away from the main tourist areas. The room was a good size as was the bathroom and it was clean. The rooms are modern and have air con. Note it does have a shower/bath, plus a separate shower. The separate shower has a screen but water leaked. So we used the shower above the bath. TV had great reception but television in Spain doesn’t have English channels. They do have a computer via TV in the room for 9 EU, for 24 hours, it is extremely difficult to navigate, I recommend you don’t. If you have a laptop they can give you a cable and access to high speed internet. This they provide free. This wasn’t advertised anywhere and we only found out the second day. They did have breakfast (buffet) for a fee but we didn’t try it. There is also a bar area, and you can get a drink or a coffee. Access to everything is great, the metro is just next door and you can get everywhere and one of the best systems (we thought) in Europe. The convenience is amazing. As it turns out, Madrid became one of our favourite places. Would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, plush and professional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: K_Christo
Reviews.Content: Vincci Capitol is a very nice hotel. The staff is professional; the lobby is immaculate; TV worked; wake-up calls were punctual, and tv has alarm clock; no Wi-Fi; the rooms are a little small. We loved the bathtub, nice and large. The room is very nice, just seemed much smaller than other hotels we stayed in. The Vincci is located within walking distance of many amazing sights and nice shopping on Gran Via. Construction is underway behind the hotel, but otherwise we enjoyed our stay at the Vincci.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent design hotel”
Reviews.Author: lachocolate
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Vincci Capitol and were pretty satisfied with everything - friendly service at the reception and during breakfast (evenings in the bar as well), clean and modern designed rooms and perfectly situated in the center of Madrid so one can reach almost all tourist attractions (including nice tapas bars and pubs/discos) by foot. For a short city trip I can highly recommend the Vincci Capitol hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: xolivia82x
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to metro, gran via and shops would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Just OK but not really!!”
Reviews.Author: gdlstx
Reviews.Content: Sad to admit, this is my first somewhat negative review about any hotel. LOCATION- This hotel is located on Gran Via, one of the major streets in Madrid... hence, its name. It's a pretty quick cab ride from the central train station -about 6euros. It's actually a decent location for shopping and dining also, and because it's not smack in the middle of the center prices are not as high. Additionally, the main tour bus stops right across the street so that was a definite plus because you can get ALL around town and back to the hotel without any problems. (by the way, I recommend purchasing the 2day bus tour tickets) STAFF- The staff did their best to be helpful from the start. When we arrived (after 3pm) our room was not yet ready and because it should have been, the manager offered us complimentary drinks in the hotel bar while we waited -that was a plus. However, that plus was canceled out by the food we decided to have w/ the drinks. The food here is not at all recommended. The manager said she'd send someone for us when the room was ready and when that didn't happen after an hour and a half, we decided to go back down. She was very apologetic, told us the room had been ready for sometime and was upset at her staff for not calling us. Whatever, it happens!! ROOMS- If you choose this hotel, I recommend a room with a terrace, it was the only PLUS. We had room 910. It offered great views of Gran Via, the city and snow capped mountains in the opposite direction. Despite its busy location, the rooms were very quite. As for the interior, we reserved a room w/ a King bed but it turned out to be a Queen. The room was also really tight as most European rooms are. These things weren't that big of a deal to us, however, the cleanliness was. The room was not well lit but I'm an inspector. The chair in the room was very dingy as were the throw pillows on the bed AND the bathroom, OY VEY, it was icky. Surprisingly it was a rather large bathroom and if it had been clean, would've been great. However, the bath tub had moldy walls and the shower floors were really gritty. Suffice to say, we opted to not use the shower. Really was a shame :( To end, this room was a definite bargain at 100euros/night and like I mentioned, the location is convenient for tourists but I would NOT stay here again. There are too many other options in this city. While we don't ever spend much time in a hotel, I do require a clean one when calling it a night. Thus, I'd advise future travelers to keep searching!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Littlesean
Reviews.Content: I looked at many hotels in Madrid before deciding on this one. The main reason we chose Vincci Capitol was due to its central location, however after spending 4 days in Madrid it is apparent how close everything is. We walked around every day and things are fairly close by including lots of other hotels! The Vincci capitol is the kind of sleek modern "boutique" hotel that we prefer and it was a nice clean hotel. We were give a tiny room though and you could almost touch both walls with you arms outstretched despite booking a junior suite in advance!! We ended up getting a move down to room 505 after being placed on the 8th floor at the side of the hotel (which we had to pay for!!). As you look at the building from the outside you can see the junior suites at the front of the building, the curved shape windows that look directly on to the Gran Via. 505 is on the second floor up and it is worth trying for one of these rooms if you like some space. The rooms nearby were also of a good size so dont settle for a "Box room". If you look closely at the fittings, fixtures and the finish you can see that they have cut corners and settled for cheaper fixtures, the shower rail and hand rail both moved and were loose, the door to the shower had not been finished and you could see the glue and nails holding the frame to the wall! The tiles felt like plastic as did the washbasin. If you dont mind these minor details then its a great look achieved on a limited budget. Not exactly top notch quality but still a nice hotel, next time i would try the Vincci 66, a bit further out (2K) but a beautiful place with a great bar and restaurant. Use the Metro if you can its easy enough but look out for thieves and hustlers in the area where you buy the tickets and on busy trains!!!! Madrid is far too "conservative" and "Middle of the Road" for me, i like vibrancy, cafe culture, multi culture and urban exitement (like barcelona), so once is enough. Go see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lou2109
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - amazing location right on the Gran Via. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and tidy. The Capitol building is iconic, and a feature in itself. Having looked at numerous hotels in Madrid online before deciding on the Vincci Capitol, it was certainly one of the most modern looking, compared to other 3 and 4 star hotels in the Gran Via area that were of a similar price. When we booked the room, we requested a double room, however having read a number of reviews from people saying they had ended up with two twins pushed together, I emailed the hotel direct to request a double. Their reply stated that they couldn't guarantee it, however when we got there, we were told they had the request and we had a double room. The room itself was nice - on the side of the hotel so not looking down the Gran Via, but still modern, clean and tidy. And yes, there is only one English TV channel (CNN), but do you really go to Madrid to watch TV in your hotel room?! It has to be said the lighting in the room is unique, and can be temperamental, but it didn't pose too many problems. Also, an added bonus is that each room has its own heating / air conditioning which you can control yourself, and the window can be opened to get fresh air in. The main selling point about the hotel has to be the location: right on the Gran Via and close to all the main attractions of the city centre. Don't forget to visit the roof terrace which offers amazing views across the city, day and night (although sadly no opportunity for a sunset viewing as it is on the wrong side of the building), and take some time to rest your feet in the hotel bar on the third floor, which offers views straight down the Gran Via. Overall, the hotel is contemporary, and high quality, and was ideal for a romantic long weekend break. I would definitely recommend it, more for a break rather than a business trip (whilst there is free wifi in the rooms, there was no desk or working space). If you're going, definitely look around for a discount on the room rate as although it's 4 star, with the poor exchange rate for travellers from the UK, it's probably not worth the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Boroughbloke
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times. It's a great hotel, with great staff, bang in the middle of the throbbing heart of Madrid. Many of the rooms have outstanding views, including their own private terraces. The worst inconvenience I ever had was getting into the door on the odd occasion when the Cine Capitol below was throwing some premiere or another.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Avey87
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our needs. It is in a perfect location, right in the centre of the city and on a metro stop. It makes sightseeing easy..:)..The room was nice, it was simple but it was clean and comfortable. I found the hotel staff very helpful and overall, it was a really enjoyable 4 night stay. Although, i wouldn recommend the food from the bar in the hotel, we ordered pizza one night and it was not pleasant!..Apart from that though, i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; very nice, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: NDx3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off one of the main streets (Gran Via) in Madrid. We thought the location was perfect as the hotel was pretty centrally located -- and no more than a 20-30 minute walk from the Prado, palace, etc. Moreover, there's a metro stop that's a 2 minute walk away and for 1 Euro you can get to the bus station, train station, or airport in about 30-40 minutes tops. The rooms are quite modern and the hotel looks to have been recently remodeled. It was well worth the deal that we got on hotels.com The hotel provides free -- VERY FAST -- internet (cable only to the best of my knowledge) and a free drink at the bar at some point during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here Unless You Smoke!”
Reviews.Author: yiqbal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Vinnci Capital as well it's affiliate- Vinnci 66 on my 10 day vacation in Madrid. I would absolutely NOT reccomend staying at either hotel unless you are a chain smoker! Im unsure as to how a previous guest found a non- smoking room as there is no such thing. Cigarette smoke in these hotels is suffocating as they allow smoking in all rooms as well as the first floor and the restaurant. It WILL filter into your room, and if you are like me and hate being involuntarily exposed DO NOT STAY HERE. And FYI, your clothes will smell too- this was particularly frustrating to have clothes that reeked for 10 days. It is in a great central location but there are many other hotels that share this location that are more stringent on smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireMike
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located on Calle Gran Via just steps from the Callo Metro stop and about a 2 minute walk to Sol. Within 10 minute walk you can reach many major sites like the Plaza Major, Palacio Real, Teatro Real and Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza. In the immediate vicinity of the hotel, there are a couple of huge movie theatres, lots of restaurants, department stores and cafes. I could not find a grocery store anywhere nearby. This area of town seems to be the main, modern, commercial hub. I had a double room on the 8th floor with a large walk out balcony (excellent sunset views of the city). On the surface the hotel has a contemporary, style with clean lines and a rich but subdued colour scheme. I actually liked having the hardwood flooring instead carpeting for a change. The hotel is relatively new, so most things still look fresh and function as they should. A closer inspection shows some cost-saving choices, like a plastic wash basin and thin wood veneers. However, these do not detract from the look and feel. I had a shower but no bath, but I prefer this anyway. The shower stall was large and had a wonderful textured stone floor and walls and a huge, high-mounted shower head. The room could have been slightly larger and I think a coffee/tea maker should be provided. Service was very friendly and efficient. Because I was exhausted the first night of arrival, I tried to order room service - but be warned, unlike at the front desk, not much English is spoken elsewhere in the hotel. That was not a big deal as it forced me to practice my Spanish. Overall, this is a good hotel in a convenient location. I don't think it is quite a 4 star hotel. It is definitely better than 3 stars however, so I'll give it the benefit of the doubt. While I liked the hotel, I think next time I'd prefer to stay in Old Madrid south of Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but typical european hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenjenf
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our first night in Spain based off other reviews from TripAdvisor.com. The hotel was typically European with VERY small regular rooms and bathrooms. The hotel is a great value and pretty centrally located to most Madrid attractions. There are several metro stops very close by and the tourist bus also has several stops nearby. The only problem with this hotel is the parking. The hotel recommended a "very close" parking lot which turned out to be only 2 blocks away. However, getting to the entrance of the parking lot took a minor miracle. The hotel is on the Gran Via which is a very congested 6 lane thoroughfare. Depending in the direction in which you approach the hotel, you could go 2 miles out of your way to be able to turn left into the parking lot. The lot itself is not well marked once you get off the main road so keep your eyes peeled. Parking is extremely expensive (35 euro) so if you can avoid picking up your rental car until you are ready to leave Madrid, do so. The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful considering we arrived around 10 am and they made sure our room was ready as early as possible (we got into the room at 1:00 pm). The bed and pillows were comfortable and they had a lot of amenities in the bathroom (hair dryer, bath gel, shampoo, conditioner, lotion). It was perfect for our needs as we were only there one night.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: lenchkin
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely brilliant! I stayed here with my boyfriend for a long weekend. Room was lovely and the bed was really comfortable. Also found no problems with noise, admittedly we weren't facing the street. The only slight niggles I did have were with the lights (the switch turned on the lights in the main room as well as the bathroom making it a bit inconvenient at night) and the shower (leaked a lot on the floor).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharleyAnderson
Reviews.Content: We booked the Vincci Capitol, Madrid and stayed there for a week at the beginning of September 2008. When we checked in we were given a smoking room with no view and we had specifically requested a non-smoking. We went back to reception and asked politely if we could have a non smoking room with a view. We were given room 207 which was fantastic. We could see up and down the Gran Via and the room was spacious. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Seeing Stars at the Vincci Capitol”
Reviews.Author: Viajera09
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was totally re-done less than a year ago, so everything is new, clean and modern. Our bed was big and comfortable and the "pillow menu" made sure we slept well. And the staff were very kind throughout. For us, the best parts were the bathroom - both a big bathtub and a luxuriously large shower - and the location. Not only is it close to everything, but the movie theater next door hosts all the releases. The new Che movie was feted while were there with lots of red carpets and lights -- and we even saw Benicio del Toro in the hotel bar later that night! Don't forget to check out the solarium and the view deck on the top floors. We will definitely be back at our next chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good views but your'll pay for them”
Reviews.Author: Ms_fusspot
Reviews.Content: Was impressed with the location and interior design for the hotel although the smell of popcorn from the cinema was overwelming. However our party of three rooms two rooms ended up being upgraded to get somewhere near decent ended up costly. The standard room we were offered on the 11th floor was very small and claustrophobic, my parents agreed and went for an instant upgrade with terrace area for 40 euro's each night. The one single traveller with our party loved her room as although it was small there was a lovely terrace area. We did get our upgraded room but the first one offered was just as small as the standard and the porter and receptionist couldn't understand why I refused to accept that room. Eventually we were offered a very large circular room with views overlooking the avenue, although no terrace area was worth the 120 euro cost. I also had fault with our room service. The cleaning was very poor with rubbish and empty containers left. I did call for ice and clean glasses as the maid had not washed them in two days. I was told the ice was free however the clean glasses would cost 7 euros. After a brief discussion I settled for free ice and rinsing out the old ones. The mini bar is expensive but the free toiletries good. Tip to any one staying ignore the minibar and go over to the large department store over the road,. the basement has a large supermarket for rose wine for 3 euro's and lots of cheaper snacks. Missed a swimming pool and the spa was 25 euros each for private visits of 30 minutes only. Location for the hotel is very good, and if only staying for a day I would stay here again, anywhere longer would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DrCorona
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of the location and great reviews on tripadvisor! The price was very good when you consider the location, we payed 110€ for a standard room. The staff was friendly and very helpful with the few questions we had. The decor looks exactly as those shared by members on tripadvisor. The only negative was that there was a lot of dents in the hotel decor. I think that the hotel is worth 5/5 because of the: location, price, friendly staff and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings....”
Reviews.Author: LeginLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located right in the middle of the city, and this was our third visit. During our previous visits we had booked Executive rooms which had been nice and relatively modern. This year after viewing the hotel web site, pictures and 'virtual tours' I decided to splash out on what appeared to be a decent sized Junior Suite costing around 390 euros per night. This appeared from the pictures on the hotels own web site to have a seperate lounge area, jacuzzi bath, even a really special looking round bed. At check in we were given keys for from 902, which I was assured was a Junior Suite. Image our dissappointment when we found that the room was actually smaller than that we had stayed in the previous year - no bigger than a basic room. The bed was a very small double. It had no seperate seating area, and a standard bath (which doubled as a shower). I immediately phone reception and was advised that 902 was classed as Junior Suite because it had a small terrace! I was informed the manager was out and nothing could be done that night. The next morning I met with the Manager. I explained that the room was nothing like that which was being marketed on this hotel web site and certainly not worth 390 euros per night (surely there must be laws against misleading advertising in Spain?). She agreed with me that 902 was not in anyway like a Junior Suite featured on the web site. We were offered room 903 (next door). 903 featured a larger, king sized bed and seperate lounge. The bathroom was identical to those in other parts of the hotel (in which some of our friends were staying). Interestingly the manager said that they only have one suite that looks like the suite marketed on the internet. And what appears to be a large round feature bed in the suite is really only suitable for single use. Marketing these rooms like this is in my view really misleading. At check out, we were still charged the full price for the first night. Other points to note. It seems that the hotel has problems with the showers - which leak water onto the floor. Be careful not to slip. Notwithstanding the above problems, if we go back to Madrid we may still consider booking this hotel because of its location - but would stick firmly to a standard or executive room. Take a Ethernet cable if you want to use the internet. TV, movies and TV internet is charged at a flat rate of 25 euros a day!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the design”
Reviews.Author: vacante
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a Art Deco building with a cinema on the lower floors. The decor is design (1960s) and I loved the combination of the two styles. The room was large and the bathroom almost larger with a jacuzzi and a separate shower. Very interesting lighting system with pre set "themes" - it takes you a while to get used to all the options. Good breakfast, not a huge selection but nice things, fresh fruit and good coffee. Excellent location next to the Callao underground station, very close to almost every important tourist attraction in Madrid. I will go back and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, exactly as expected”
Reviews.Author: Elvtars
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights based on the reviews and were not disappointed. I would recommend these older reviews, they are really good. Just a few small points based on our own experience. The hotel lobby is very small, almost inexistent, because the hotel shares the lower floors of the building with a movie theater. This wasn't really an issue for us, just that you know what to expect. The restaurant and bar are on the first floor. A few select rooms have the terrific view of the Grand Via shown in the photographs. Most windows simply face the building across the street. Yet other windows open to a plain interior courtyard. Something to keep in mind if this is important to you. We had a room to the courtyard and it was very quiet. If you need to wear earplugs to sleep like I do, this may be a good trade. Some reviewers mentioned issues with the lights. Although the light controls are indeed unusually complicated, (7 buttons in total, only labeled in Spanish) they worked fine. The issue may be that the first two buttons from the top are switching and dimming the lights both in the room and in the bathroom at the same time. With the next two below them you can control the lights independently. I have a similar observation about the TV. You can watch regular broadcast TV channels, but you'll need to navigate through the menu system to get there. Finally, what you read here about the darkness of the colors used everywhere through the hotel is true. Not a big issue for us, but I can see why not everybody likes it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mahlerfan
Reviews.Content: I just had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location is excellent, at the Plaza Callai, along Gran Via, across the street from the Metro station and a five minute walk to Puerta del Sol. It's also a short, 15-20 minute walk to the Prado and the Palace. The rooms are ultra-modern, quiet and quite large by European standards. The staff was friendly and helpful and multi-lingual. I will definitely stay here again should I visit Madrid in the future and would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flmama
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. We got a corner room, which was huge- especially by European standards. It had a large stand alone tub, double sinks and great shower. The beds were very comfortable, and the staff very helpful. We brought our 18 month old daughter, and they had a baby cot for her- that was triple-sheeted! She slept very well. The modern decor was top notch, and we didn't find the lighting to be a problem. Would stay here again without hesitation. We have stayed at many fine hotels and would say that this one ranks in our top 5.

Reviews.Title: “Classy joint”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetterkt15
Reviews.Content: We got a last minute deal on this hotel and really landed on our feet. It was in one of the main roads in the centre of it all on the gran via. I turned up for breakfast and started to help myself when the staff pointed out I had not the seen the rest of the food on the other side of the bar round the corner. It was one heck of a feast so be sure to have breakfast included. The staff were very professional and helpful. The rooms were pretty quiet. The only down side was the lighting some crazy german idea that the entire room and bathroom be fitted to the same system. so you could not nip to the lav in the middle of the night without waking your partner/ person in the twin bed. The room was a bit to small for twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: 2008Nicky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March and really enjoyed my stay. The reception staff were very helpful and recommended some good local restaurants. My sister was not a huge 'tapas' fan so I would suggest a restaurant called 'Ginger' serving Mediterranean food (Plaza del Angel) and a great Italian called Pasta Nostra, Pizza Nostra (on Carrera de San Jeronimo) The location was fabulous - so close to the Callao underground station and a few minutes walk to the 'Sol' Square. I would recommend this hotel if you are visiting Madrid and enjoy contemporary surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Funky rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Bomberlow
Reviews.Content: We spent a Friday and Saturday night at the Vincci after a last minute booking (had double checked the reviews for this hotel at this great site to make sure it was ok, prior to booking). The hotel is very modern-art deco and our rooms were clean and comfortable. The large overhead shower was brilliant. Firstly this hotel is excellent for a swift visit to Madrid, close to the Metro and on top of all the places you need to cram in on a whistle stop tour. Positives: - Great location - Clean and comfortable rooms. - Nice staff. The negatives: - If i was to stay here longer than a weekend, i think the dark lighting and all the walls,and floors being black would get me down a bit. A little claustrophobic. -The lighting in the bathroom for the ladies to put on makeup is not ideal. - The TV does not broadcast local tv, it only does pay-per-view movies, news and music which were all a rip-off. I love being abroad and switching on the local telly and having a chessy music station on or just checking out the local tv. whilst getting ready to go out. All in all, would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially for the price i paid ;-) Madrid is an amazing city and if your only here for a weekend, you really shouldn't be in your bed all that much! PS, our visit to Madrid was really made when we booked a Tapas tour for the Saturday. The popular and busy Tapas restaurants can be a bit intimidating and scary if you don't know what to order, drink etc. This tour was excellent and our guide introduced us to many off the 'tourist track' tapas bars. Look on the internet for Adventurous Appetites, Madrid. You wont be dissapointed. Hasta luego!

Reviews.Title: “I am pretty easy going but this was a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: BenChorley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Vincci in March of 2008 , When we first arrived everything was OK. The style of the hotel is very modern and very posh. The building is very impressive and is based in the middle of Madrid within walking distance of all the sites. Our trouble started however when we found on our second night that the heating had broken. To cut a long story short we complained four times over the next two days, each time it was promised that they would fix it, each time we returned to our room it was not working. The staff were really unhelpful and just seemed to shrug a lot. The fourth time they sent the security guard up to look!!! The Television in the room didn't work also , but this didn't bother me too much because my Spanish is minimal. If the heating and the television had worked I would have said this was an excellent hotel, however the staffs attitude was shocking. I would not stay here. Also to note Madrid was really cold in March!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and central”
Reviews.Author: Erkmen
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel we stayed in Madrid before going to Andalucia. The hotel is located at piazza Calau and Calau metro stop is just in front of the hotel. The hotel is also at the most lively place of Gran Via and short walking distance to piazza del sol, which is the town main attractions center. Location vise the hotel is excellent. When we checked in there was a little surprise, but they solved the problem and let us to our rooms. The rooms are big, very modern and nice. The bed is comfortable, only if there has been a double bed instead of two connected single beds, it would be excellent. The bathroom is extra nice with bath tube and bathroom accessories. I can easily say that the room is one of the nicest ones that we have stayed since now. Considering that most hotels in Europe are old and small, this is totally different than the general. If I would go to Madrid, I will pay the extra Euros and stay again in this hotel with no necessary to check another one. Especially after having a bad taste at Hotel El Prado on the return way, we felt the value of this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Elsa3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. The location was right next to the metro stop so it was easy to get anywhere in the city. We found the staff helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and well decorated. My husband and I travel internationally ~8 times a year and this was definitely a good value hotel. We were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: Kanem
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location, opposite the metro calleo. The metro station is within the airport terminal - but was approx 15 mins walk from where we passed airport control (so those with walking difficulties may wish to pay the extra and get a taxi). We had to change 2/3 times, however such a different experience to the London underground. It was cheap (2 euros each), clean and easy to follow the directions. One lady on the metro offered to swap seats, so that myself and my husband could sit together - again you wouldn't get that in London. We booked this room, quite last minute and although we had booked a double - we had noted a kingsize bed on the preferences. So we were upgraded, the room had a kingsize bed and a massive jacuzzi pool bath. The room was very clean and very modern, however the jacuzzi didn't work. When we phoned reception, they weren't very helpful (my husband is half spanish - so not a language problem) and we got the impression when we checked in that they were under staffed. Anyway, as we were only staying the one night and the shower worked, we didn't push the issue. Considering we were in the heart of Madrid, we were not disturbed during the night at all by any kind of noise. The hotel bar was nice, the service was excellent. They could have made better use of the view- which was obsured by the window dressing. The only down point was the bar menu - no cocktails. Nice to chill out in or have a night cap. Didn't have breakfast - so can't comment. Other comments re Madrid as a place to visit. - Excellent friendly place to visit. - Great people. - Didn't feel threatened at any point or speak to anyone who had been pickpocketed - you just need to have the common sense that you would use when visiting any major city. - Hotel above average in decor, setting - however let down by some poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: SarahLeigh33
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 days at the beginning of January, and we were delighted with our trip! On arrival, the staff were attentive and extremely helpful. The receptionist offered us an upgrade, which we accepted. Our room was on the 11th floor, with the best view from the hotel...the whole of the city, and mountains surrounding madrid! the kingsize bed was lovely and the choice of pillows is a bonus. The location of the hotel is perfect, Callao Metro Station located just outside (half an hour to airport), and within walking distance of Puerto de Sol and the Plaza Mayor..(this is where you will find the most lovely little tapas bars!) There are also plenty of more formal restaurants dotted around the area, i suggest leaving the heals at home for the evening and just strolling around reading menus to find what tickles your fancy, you'll be spoilt for choice. This was our second trip to Madrid and it did not disappoint, we will definitely be returning to this wonderful city, and would both stay at the Vincci Capitol without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for New Year”
Reviews.Author: TheGrimesReview
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for New Year in Madrid. There was 6 of us visiting madrid and we were therefore looking for a centrally located hotel. You could not get more central than this one. Right in the middle of Gran Via and only 5 mins walk to the main Plaza for the new year party which was ideal. You are also not far from the Palace and metro stops etc. There are plenty bars and places to eat near the hotel but venture across to Plaza Santa Anna for some great places. This is where Vincci Soho and Room Mate Alicia hotels are based and if going back to Madrid for a break would stay here. As we were looking for New Year base the Capitol suited just fine. Hotel itself was clean and comfortable if a bit on the warm side. We were lucky enough to get room 803 which has a roof terrace with fantastic views across Madrid. It also meant we could keep the terrace door open during the night to keep cool. Never ate breakfast so can't comment but bar prices seemed reasonable for a city centre hotel. All in all good hotel and reasonably priced and ideal for new year.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, good quality”
Reviews.Author: Malou75
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Vincci Capitol Hotel with my husband. Madrid is full of hotels, but we chose this hotel after having read the reviews on this site. The Vincci Capitol is very good located in the center of the city and we only used transportation for going to the railway station one morning (by metro, metro station in front of hotel) and for going to the airport (by taxi, app. 40 euros on a Sunday). Otherwise you can walk everywhere. The first room we got was on the 6th floor with a great view over the city. The room was very modern and nice, but unfortunatelly it was very hot in the room. The personnel told us that nothing could be done because the AC in the hotel only works in the summertime and told us to open the window. There was no window (only a balcony that could not be opened) to open i the rooom so after two nights we changed rooms to one with a window (on the 4th floor) and the problem was solved. Apart from this the only negative thing to be said about the rooms is the lightening (about which I had read previously on this site). You can not, for example, only have the bathroom light on and not the light in the room, which causes some problems in the night if either one of you wants to go to the bathroom... The breakfast was excellent and I think the personnel was quit friendly. It seems that almost no-one in Madrid speeks english, and the personnel in the Vincci Capitol at least understands something... I would absolutely recommend this clean, modern hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Something different.”
Reviews.Author: steph67
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something a bit different for your stay in Madrid this is the hotel for you, Very centrally located in the city centre yards from shops, bars and Metro station. Very modern interior with suberb, large rooms with all mod cons. If ever going back to Madrid I would definetly not look past this hotel. Downside though was not a problem for us was that there is no restaraunt for evening meals but as there are so many restaraunts close by there is really no need for one. Also if travelling in November as we did, bring lots of warm clothes as it was very cold, 2 degrees! Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: LondonBetty1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading some of the reviews - some good and some bad. I would strongly advise anyone looking to stay at the Vincci Capitol to rethink. The room was unclean, with glassess not having been washed and the bath still showing signs of usage from the previous occupier. The hotel stafff were incredibely unhelpful, there were approx 4 staff behind the counter all talking amongst themselves whilst 1 saw to the customers all speaking very little english. We put the "do not disturb sign" on our door prior to going out for the day only to find on our return that the sign had been ignored and our room had been made up. The maid had also helped herself to a snack from our minibar and left the wrapper on top of my clean clothes. We went down to reception to query this, they called the maid and advised us that the maid was a very honest and trustworthy member of staff and there was no reason to doubt her when she advised there was no sign on left on the door and that she had found the empty wrapper on the floor and that was the end of the matter. We asked to speak to the General Manager who took our comments on board and moved us to a newly opened Vincci hotel approximately 20 doors down from the vincci capital. I would not stay at the Vincci Capital if I were offered rooms for free. There are plenty of other hotels in Madrid to choose from with a number having the same location. This hotel ruined our long awaited trip to Madrid I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS!”
Reviews.Author: nupi
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Vincci Capitol hotel with my boyfriend for a weekend city break. Unluckily we were both pickpocketed on the way to the hotel. On arriving the staff were unhelpful, only telling us where the local police station was. Staff were generally like this during our stay, did not feel as though we could ask them for recommendations etc, felt very unfriendly... However, the location of this hotel is amazing, we got the metro on the odd occasion but everything worth seeing in a weekend is within walking distance of this hotel, puerta del sol - 5-10mins walk and plaza mayor is another 5 from there. there are plenty of places to eat around the hotel. Hotel is clean, rooms slightly small but nice. We ended up staying in the room behind the Schweppes sign which was quite cool but at night our room was like a disco, and soundproofing was not great at all... Overall, would stay here again because of the great location, nice clean, but you do pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position but ...”
Reviews.Author: kramerdude
Reviews.Content: This hotel was subsituted for another Vincci hotle in Madrid, but it was supposed to have similar features, and be located in a great position. I guess I had been spoiled travelling from Berlin where service and facilities had been first class. The first thing that struck me was the fact that in their total renovations they had forgotten the lighting in the rooms - it was such as stange system that inly the Spanish could understand it, nut even they could not really explain why you could not have a reading light on in bed and also have the main lights on, or why the bathroom light could not be switched on without the rest of the room being lit up. In the same vein it took 3 hours and 3 calls to get a light globe changed - they seem to be a bit short on service staff, and also on bi-lingual (english) staff. From my point of view the highlight was the breakfast and it should not be missed - great variety and well displayed - the reception satff tried hard but appeared to be under a bit of stress with the number of guests in the hotel, and the concierge staff were very willing. Position was excellent being in the centre of down-town Madrid, with all transport at the door, and all shops and services avalable.

Reviews.Title: “unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: skydriver
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the action, this hotel is an oasis. You can't help but be struck by the arcitecture, and the decor of the "space". Heavy Art Deco, glass, chrome, black floors abound. You can get a pretty good idea of the look of the place by checking out the hotel's website. We did upgrade to the slightly larger room, so keep that in mind when reading. I was very happy with the ample space in the room, nice lighting and wonderfully insulated from the din outside. Street noise and even a jackhammer across the way did not bother me when the windows were shut. I had a very quiet night's sleep (I was on the 7th floor). Cool glass elevators are the centerpiece of the architecture. My co-worker got a really neat room (706), which is like the prow of a ship. It is the rounded edge of the building, making for an awesome view of the street below. Check out the Solarium on the 7th floor. Very cool view of the old city, great meeting place for your group before tapas or dinner. I don't know much about Art Deco, but it appears style is more important than functionality. The chairs in the room are uncomfortable and tiny, and there isn't a desk, if you require that during your stay. Location is central. Plaza Mayor is a quick walk, Plaza del Sol is right around the corner, shopping galore, tapas are close (of course) and a metro station is right outside the door. Bottom line: Clean, roomy, central downtown hotel. No gym, but a spa is here (I didn't have time to check it out). Internet available.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, better for tourists than for business”
Reviews.Author: cla114
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Gran via, very central and good for tourists, not so much for businesspeople. The area is considered fairly downmarket (it's a bit like downton LA, crowded but the nice places are elsewhere) and the only advantage is that it's near the main attractions and always crowded. The hotel is modern but with already some signs of wear, and not too clean either. The room they gave me was very small and VERY dark. Price was not high for Madrid but not too low either. Will not go back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mccrudden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brilliantly located just off Sol. The reception area is very small but modern with 24hr reception & security. The hotel has 4 lifts (2 glass). The room is exactly as advertised in the photos - contemporary design and very classy. Beds are very comfortable with extra pillows in the press. Mini bar is small but sufficient. The tv does not have decent channels in English - only the news. The bathroom is excellent, very clean & big and nicely fitted out. The toiletries provided are great (shampoo, condt, shower gel, razor, toothbrush & paste etc). The room has mood lighting which gives a luxurious feel. One of our rooms was street facing & the other had an internal window - both were bright and not noisy. The a/c worked perfectly. Wooden floorboards. There is a bar/cafe on one of the floors which we didn't visit as Starbucks is right outside and we love it. The roof terrace is literally a large balcony, you wouldn't hang out there but if you want to see some roof tops its ok - I would recommend going to the roof bar at the 'Me by Melia' hotel for great views & drinks. No wifi available. Brilliant hotel if you want to base yourself in a great location for sight seeing & come back to lovely comfortable bed. Not a hotel that you hangout in as it has little to offer. We will definately go back. Booked standard room for less than 100 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Contemporary Hotel provides all necessaries.”
Reviews.Author: Thumper_215
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this hotel which starts, first, with a great staff. We tried to communicate in Spanish as well as we could and the staff appreciated this and kindly helped us as much as they could. Night Audit clerk gave a minor shrug when I asked him where I could get ice, but said he woudl have it brought to the room. It arrived promptly. He did the same thing the next night, but I liked him and was happy he had it sent up to us so quickly. The decor is more modern than what we expected. The room lighting is hard to control as you think you are trying to raise the dim lights on in the batrhoom and all of the room lights come on. During our two day stay, we never figured out how to turn the lighting on the way we wanted it. The beds were comfortable and we got plenty of sleep while at the hotel. The bathroom had a large sink in it which reminded me of a sink you would see in a utility laundray room. All water and plumbing worked fine. Other than these few comments, I must say that we truly enjoyed the service and the property and most important, the friendliness and hospitality of the hotel staff. I would not hesitate to return to this location if I am ever in Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Irelandhorse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the centre of everything, The shopping area is right outside the door of the hotel and the ''old part of the city '' Plaza de Mayor is about 5 mins walk away with lots of lovely restaurants and bars. The metro station is also right across from the hotel. The hotel is very modern and trendy . It is very clean and got clean towels everyday ,The staff were also very friendly and helpful .. overall I would recommend this hotel if you want a place that is near everything..

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel”
Reviews.Author: arsenal7533
Reviews.Content: Great design hotel. Location is fantastic, right on the gran via. Rooms are small but nicely appointed. Fantastic view from the two solarium on the 7th and 9 th floor. Nice breakfast. Very freindly and helpfull staff. Great choice for Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card Statement....”
Reviews.Author: HenNight
Reviews.Content: Had a superb time, loved the hotel, location is definitly the best. Room are very modern ours was farily big. Look out for the sun terrace, on the 7th floor i think. My only note of caution is that I have had credit card fraud. I used my card when I checked into this hotel, to activate the safe and in the Nike store. So 50-50 Chance it happened in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE-Growing pains or permanent trouble?”
Reviews.Author: ovlov246
Reviews.Content: Based on recent positive reviews my husband and I thought we'd give this new hotel a try (its been open 2 mos). BEWARE! Still going thru some growing pains, but I suspect its a more pervasive problem than that. We a nice king bedded room, even a bonus terrace overlooking the Grand Via. However, when we were awakened at 2am sweating to death, we realized the air conditioning only blew HOT air. Needless to say we weren't going to call reception at that hour, but we had a totally sleepless night as the sirens roared down the Grand Via. And all but 2 TV channels were snow (and only spanish-language channels). Did I also mention one of the towels hanging was visibly filthy when we checked in? Normally overlook this kind of thing since we're pretty easy going but it was just more evidence of the lack of attention to detail throughout the hotel. In the morning, when we went to reception to describe these problems, the receptionist appeared to take interest and said it would be taken care of by the time we got back from sightseeing. Oh, the explanation for the spanish-only channels was the following: "We've only been open 2 months and we don't have the satellite yet." Of course when we returned nothing was fixed and the afternoon receptionist had no knowledge of our morning discussion. They then sent someone to our room to check the A/C (si, caliente, senora!) and we were switched to a lower floor, interior view room for our troubles (but clean towels, working A/C, and 10 clear spanish TV channels at least). This process took 1.5 HOURS. When we asked to speak to a manager, the receptionist told us he doesn't speak English (a problem with many of the staff members, and the command of the desk staff is frankly not great). When I told the receptionist that I was disappointed by the way things had been handled, and described that hotels would typically give a free upgrade or substantial discount for a sleepless night such as ours, we got an offer of free breakfast. A small token but I shouldn't have had to ask if the hotel was genuinely remorseful or cared about customer service. Yes, rooms are modern and although small (expected for any city center location), well designed with reasonable storage space if you're staying a 1-3 nights. Anything longer and the closet/drawer space will be insufficient in a standard room. Location and free (wired) internet is a definite plus, and if they can get their act together, could be a great find. Overall, the Vincci Capitol is inconsistent, both in terms of the physical hotel and the staff. I sincerely hope they improve.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at given rates & location”
Reviews.Author: donovanSY
Reviews.Content: We are a family with a young one from Singapore. We loved the hotel's great location along gran via as its walking distance of the old city of madrid. The setup is new as its newly refurbished and given the location, its rates are attractive. Our room is of a decent size even though we added in a roll away bed. We stayed on the 6th floor and there were hardly any street noises. There are nearby eateries and the metro is extremely near for reach into other parts of madrid. The modern furbishing & look also went down well with our family although the water drainage of the toilet can be improved... Another pleasant surprise is the FOC internet access which is normally chargeable in other hotels. We will definitely stay at this hotel again if we do visit Madrid if the conditions remain the same or are better. Don

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel- completely refurbished”
Reviews.Author: JennyCoDown
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing room (room 411) with a fantastsic view of downtown madrid. A real buzz at night. This hotel is perfect for visiting all the main attractions-all within a short walking distance. The lobby has a cool glass lift and the staff are very friendly. The hotel rooms are equipt with everything from slippers to shaving kits, plus you can even choose the lighting in your room from welcoming to relaxing- this can all be chosen from your bed! Well worth a visit and a good price too. Dont be put off by earlier review - the hotel is very modern and clean.

HotelInfo.Name: Vincci Capitol Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Via 41, 28013 Madrid, Spain
